review.reviewBody: I didn’t - and still don’t - see any mention of the fact that the insert isolates the pointer finger, meaning that there’s no skin-to-skin contact with the index finger and the rest, or the palm. review.reviewBody: I like these pants. They are very good quality and I love the loose fit through the thighs. The only issue I have is getting them to stay up. I feel like they need to be higher-waisted or something. The waist feels like it cuts in too much for where it sits so I have to constantly pull them up. I am usually a 6 but I am about 5 lbs thinner than normal (5.9" and 132 lbs). I bought the 6 and they were way too big and the 4 also feels a little too big and seems to stretch out during the day. I usually have issue with my thighs be too big but these are plenty room in the thigh and "saddle bag" area. These pants are really almost perfect, with just some adjustment in the fit in the waist they would be my absolutely favorite
review.name: Good quality, have issues staying up

review.reviewBody: These pants are nice for work, where I am sometimes in the office and sometimes outside. I like that the legs are not super wide but do give me room to move. I ordered a size 6
review.name: Nice work pants

review.reviewBody: I liked the design of the pants. The material could have been a softer material, but am happy with it.
review.name: Folly Twill Pants

review.reviewBody: Very soft fabric. I ended up buying these pants in 2 colors. Can be casual or dress them up. Love them!
review.name: Great alternative to jeans!

review.reviewBody: My favorite pant this fall! I purchased this in every color available and also for Christmas presents. Great fit ~ true to size. I usually wear a 6 and purchased a 4 because I have a smaller waist and the fit was perfect. I purchased a size 8 as a present and the person wore an 8 and that was a perfect fit too. It is well made, comfortable and love the color sections.
review.name: Women folly twill pant

review.reviewBody: I was sad I didn't love these pants fit on my. But the quality is really nice! Would love to see it in a wider legged pant!
review.name: Great pants

review.reviewBody: I have been looking for a pair of substantial weight non-jean trousers for awhile now. I’ve ordered from several companies and returned for various reasons. I have quite a few items from Free Fly so I was optimistic that these might work. They are all that and more! They are a heavier weight fabric but still nicely stretchy, super comfortable and look great! I ordered my usual size 12 in black- they are roomy but comfortably so. The color is a bit more slate than a true black. I was also very happy that they weren’t ridiculously wide legged.
review.name: Winners!

review.reviewBody: I love the sturdy construction of these pants, although I wish the olive color was darker. Also glad I sized down.
review.name: Folly Twill Pants

review.reviewBody: I purchased a size 0, they fit well in the legs and I liked the way they looked but they were baggy and bunchy around the waste/stomach so I decided to return. They are a nice sturdy fabric and the green is a good color. My waste is a 25/26.
review.name: ran big in waste

review.reviewBody: I REALLY like these pants and have already worn for 2 days running. They fit this olde lady; comfortable but not baggy or binding.
review.name: Saddie the elder says .....

name: Folly Twill Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: I was really excited when I was pulling the helmet out of the box - super lightweight! I like the magnetic buckle and high quality strap material. Unfortunately my excitement faded rapidly when I put it on my head and realized my head is far too oval shaped for this helmet. My head measures a low 58cm and a medium should be the right size but I couldn't really even get it on my head. I'd have to move up a size and in my experience that just means it may fit lengthwise but be loose on the sides. For other egg shaped noggins, check out the Poc Fornix. I'll be going back to (a new 2025 edition of) my old faithful after trying a couple different helmets.
review.name: Very light, not for egg-shaped noggins

name: Method Pro MIPS Helmet

review.reviewBody: Ordered a Med based on Castelli size chart which of course is predicated on your shoe size. Unfortunately, it does not account the size of your calves. Although the cover fits my shoe perfectly, it is impossible to zip the zipper all the way up. My calves are probably smaller than average or a cyclist so I’m not sure how other people are not having this issue. I guess an alternative would be to wear no-show or low cut socks but  I prefer to wear crew length especially in cold. Would not recommend based on this. Manufacturers should also include dimensions for  calves size with socks on to ensure they zip all the way up, which mine don’t rendering them useless
review.name: Sizing issues

review.reviewBody: Nice shoe covers and seem to be well made. Easy on and off. Very thin and on a 32F degree ride my toes got very cold. I won’t be using these for anything colder than 40F.
review.name: Good but not for cold weather

review.reviewBody: I bought the Perfetto gloves a month or so ago and love them!  So I decided to upgrade my shoe covers and am very glad I did.  These are fantastic, warm, form fitting, and very durable.  Very happy with this Perfetto line, they really live up to their name!
review.name: Another perfect Perfetto!

name: Perfetto Shoecover

review.reviewBody: I buy a lot of this item ,, all my co mountaineers so happy very usefull,,
review.name: I buy a lot of

review.reviewBody: This spoon is a fantastic shape with a decent size handle and a good shape for proper campsite mouth stuffing. The stove tools on the handle area nice bonus, meaning one less small piece to pack. Compared to the ti spoon the weight is noticeable but for the price this is a fantastic addition to your meal kit. On mine the wrench on the end has a bit of a sharp edge but nothing a file won't take care of quickly.
review.name: Best Camp Spoon?

review.reviewBody: Handy piece of kit. Rolls along nicely as a spoon, and then becomes technical with the stove. Class
review.name: Versatile

review.reviewBody: I am using this spoon now for 18 years!!! and I still love it. It was super expensive when I bought it and you would say: why should i pay so much money just for a spoon? It is the perfect size and i love it that i always have my repairkit for the Whisperlite with it.
review.name: Not just a spoon

review.reviewBody: Light and packable, the only way to improve this tool would be to make it a spork.
review.name: Almost perfect!

review.reviewBody: Spoon bowl is a nice shape. Love the added tools for my stove. Adds to the value of carrying a full sized spoon.
review.name: great spoon with extras

name: Alpine Tool Spoon

description: Buy the Eureka! Copper Canyon LX Tent: 3-Season 8 Person online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Copper Canyon LX Tent: 3-Season 8 Person
hasVariant.description: Buy the Eureka! Copper Canyon LX Tent: 3-Season 8 Person online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Coming from an old canvas-sided tent, my family definitely wanted something that would be large enough and offer great ventilation. The setup is a bit difficult from reading the instructions, at least for the first time (no breakdown of included pieces or labelled parts).
However, watching the setup video gave us what we needed: setup went from headhead-scratching to up in about 20 minutes. the tent is spacious and quite comfortable. the fly makes for excellent ventilation. What started as a confusing experience was quickly converted to an incredible appreciation for this tent. Plenty if standing room and, while we leave our devices at home, the pockets in the tent give you many stowing options. The power ports make running extension cords inside the tent a simple task. the flaps over the zippers are something that become a necessity once you have them - keeping out the surprises of the wild.

Easy to set up but had to look up directions online as it doesn’t come with any. Out tent came with stretched almost rips in the netting , see pictures below.   Very spacious but doesn’t seem to fit the price.
review.name: Ok tent but doesn’t match the price.

review.reviewBody: Great tent that we enjoyed with my family of 5. Plenty of room for all of our stuff. To make this tent even better, I would add more mesh storage pockets along the corners or walls, use zippers instead of toggles to close the windows, and lower the overall height of the ceiling. I am a short person and I can’t reach the mesh storage slings at the ceiling. But those are only small tweaks, it is a high quality tent with plenty of space.
review.name: Review from a short person

review.reviewBody: Easy setup, did well the wind and rain! Has a divider inside you can put up which was nice for separation.
review.name: Great tent.

review.reviewBody: Used on a beach family car camping trip in April. Easy set up and pack up with 2 adults or a teen. Lots of space inside and the 2 doors was a plus. Will be using this summer for backyard camping too!
review.name: Product Review

review.reviewBody: We would prefer a little more coverage from the rainfly. We are able to sleep 6 adults (guys 6' 7" 6' 3" and 6 ft) and 3 dogs when we have the whole family. When it's just the 2 of us we use half for sleeping and a place to hang out when the weather is bad or we need shade while the other half is our kitchen and bathroom. I love my Eureka tents. I have a 35 yo Denali that is like new. If you take care of them they will last.
review.name: Our go to adventure basecamp

review.reviewBody: I've been using mine nightly since the end of May this year (2023). Considering the design of the windows - which do not include zippers and/or velcro to fully close, and would otherwise keep the interior air warmer - I'm surprised they haven't let much, if any, rain in.
review.name: So Far So Good, But Drafty

review.reviewBody: Thin material blows with the wind cause the windows have no zippers. super duper bright inside .could not upload .mov sorry. no wind to show you..we camp every weekend except when it rains.. NOW...
review.name: stick with your old copper canyon
comment: Thank you for your review of the Copper Canyon. The Toggle & Ring system for closing window flaps is used to eliminate wear-n-tear of so many zippers (commonly first thing to fail on tents of this size). Overlap of the inner flaps and the outer sidewalls still provides protection against rain and there are small drain holes on the outer portion of these overlapping fabrics. We invite you to call Customer Service at 1-800-572-8822 if you encounter other questions or issues with the design.

review.reviewBody: After 17 years I had to finally retire my Columbia Bay Cougar Tent. I had read reviews on this gave it a shot. Finally used it this weekend. Underwhelmed to say the least. Windows are not zippered so to keep the water from coming in the design team flared the window cover and added a drain. Yes water drains but this adds bugs to your tent. It also didn’t seem as sturdy as my former tent as there were no cross rails on the bay windows. The screens brand new had many “runs” and the floor is in no way puncture resistant. After one 3 day trip and one day of rain my center supports (white poles) already began to rust. This could pass as a backyard tent but not for that price.  Look elsewhere
review.name: Look elsewhere
comment: Thank you for taking the time to leave your review. I am sorry to hear about your experience with you Copper Canyon LX 8. If you could give us a call at 1-800-572-8822 8am-5pm EST Monday-Friday, We would like the opportunity to speak with you to assist you further on your concerns.

review.reviewBody:
Amazing glamping tent!! My partner and I wanted more space so we upgraded to this. 
We just used it in Moab for a 7 day trip and it’s by far the nicest tent we’ve ever used. The tall ceilings are a game changer- my husband is 6’2 and he loved being able to stand up straight through our the entire space (I had to remind him a few times that he was bent over for no reason though haha). We didn’t get any rain, but quality felt amazing- don’t see any issues in the future. 
We had company a few nights and we threw up the wall divider so each couple had their own space- even that felt luxurious. 

Definitely recommend spending the money and investing in this tent!
review.name: We love Glamping

name: Copper Canyon LX Tent: 3-Season 8 Person

hasVariant.description: Buy the Coleman Roadtrip Swaptop Cast Iron Grill Grate online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Roadtrip Swaptop Cast Iron Grill Grate
review.reviewBody: Our cast iron grate was dropped and broke. It was easy to find a replacement part.
review.name: Fast and easy replacement

review.itemreviewed: Roadtrip Swaptop Cast Iron Grill Grate
review.reviewBody: I can't get the lid closed with the grates that were sent to me.  Coleman wants me to send pictures but I don't have that capability.  I got this grill 2 weeks ago and I have checked and rechecked the instruction booklet, the grill itself and no luck.  I have the part # on the grates it's 9949 & 9406.  The picture looks the same as what I received but the grates are too big and won't let me close the lid properly.  Why can't Coleman just confirm the part # and the model to make sure it's compatible.  Frustrating to say the leaset.
comment:
Dear Consumer, 
We apologize for the inconvenience you're experiencing with your Coleman grill. We understand your frustration and want to help resolve this issue as quickly as possible. While we typically request pictures to better assess the situation, we'll do our best to assist you without them. Can you please provide the model number of your grill so we can verify compatibility with the grates you received? ! We would like to have a chance to assist you further, that is why we strongly encourage you to reach out to us directly via our official page "Contact Us" to help you faster. 
Once we have this information, we'll work to find a solution for you. 
Thank you for your patience.
Coleman Consumer Care.

review.itemreviewed: Roadtrip Swaptop Cast Iron Grill Grate
review.reviewBody: Very sturdy piece of cast iron. Works with the road trip grill can swap sides for griddle plate or grill plate depending on what you're cooking now issues cleans well
review.name: Sturdy

review.itemreviewed: Roadtrip Swaptop Cast Iron Grill Grate
review.reviewBody: Received as expected in good condition & timely manner
review.name: RoadTrip® Swaptop™ Cast Iron Grill Grate

review.itemreviewed: Roadtrip Swaptop Cast Iron Grill Grate
review.reviewBody: Customer service  - good, Quality of grill replacement - bad. This grill has a rough surface compared with the original. I think the barbeque should be sold with all grill or all gridle
review.name: swap top grill
comment:
Hi Sharon,

Thank you for contacting Coleman, the Outdoor Company, and taking the time to provide feedback on our Coleman® RoadTrip® Swaptop™ Cast Iron Grill Grate. We're glad you appreciate our customer service, but we're sorry to hear that our swaptop grill has a rough surface compared to the original and that you believe the grill should come with all of the accessories. We appreciate your time and effort for bringing this to our attention and we apologize if our product did not exceed your expectations. This is certainly not the experience we want you to have. We want to make sure that we provide quality products that have great value, stylish and will suit your needs. As we are looking for ways to better our product and service, we always ensure that consumers' feedback and concerns are shared with the concerned department.

Please let us know if you need further assistance.

Have a wonderful day.

review.itemreviewed: Roadtrip Swaptop Cast Iron Grill Grate
review.reviewBody: This gate is not a true replacement. It is cast iron and too heavy, which defeats the purpose of the lightweight Roadtrip grill. The original grate had a nice non-stick surface whereas this grate sticks to everything cooked on it, and then requires vigorous scrubbing barely short of a sandblaster to get it clean. It is true junk.
review.name: Very Hard to Clean
comment:
Hello Sandblaster,
We understand your disappointment with the replacement grate and agree that this is not acceptable...
It’s important to us that our consumers are more than satisfied and we would like the opportunity to resolve this issue immediately.
We will make sure that this will be address  with our Quality team to review the item.
We will use the feedback to make us better .

review.itemreviewed: Roadtrip Swaptop Cast Iron Grill Grate
review.reviewBody: I love the grill. It’s easy to use and set up. However the flame is so close to the grates you burn everything even on low. Everything sticks to the grates. I have tried almost everything non stick. Whatever you cook will burn on the grate and keep burning and cooks on to your food.
review.name: Poor grates
comment:
Hi Chrisp24, 
We're truly sorry if the food is burnt due to grate is close to the flame. We always aim to deliver a great experience. We are gutted when we miss the mark! If you give us a chance, we are intent on making this right and hope you will allow us to speak with you to discuss the situation. Please give us a call at 1-800-835-327 and we'll be more than happy to assist you. We look forward to hearing from you and earn you back as a customer.

review.itemreviewed: Roadtrip Swaptop Cast Iron Grill Grate
review.reviewBody: This is a functional grill grate; however, it is not at all what I expected when ordering. I thought I would receive an identical grill grate as came with our Road Trip LX grill. The original is lightweight, non-stick and very easy to clean. This HEAVY cast iron is so much less fun to haul around and not quite as easy to wipe off as the original. I searched and searched hoping you could order more of the exact grate that comes with the grill, but this appears to be it. While it works, I'm disappointed.
review.name: Not the same as the original that came with the gr
comment:
Hello there! Thank you for contacting Coleman, the Outdoor Company, and for taking the time to provide feedback on our Coleman RoadTrip® Swaptop™ Cast Iron Grill Grate. We're sorry to hear that the replacement grill grate isn't the same as the original that came with the grill. We appreciate you for bringing this to our attention. We apologize for your negative experience with our product. We work passionately to achieve such satisfaction from our customers by continuously improving our products and services. As we are looking for ways to better our product and service, we always ensure that consumers' feedback and concerns are shared with the concerned department. Please let us know if you need further assistance.

Please let us know if there is anything else we can do to help you. We value your time and will be pleased to assist you if you have any more questions or issues. Have a wonderful day.

review.itemreviewed: Roadtrip Swaptop Cast Iron Grill Grate
review.reviewBody: Maybe if the original grates weren't made out of cast aluminum and melted into the grill I wouldn’t of had to replace them with new grates that you manufacture from cast iron.
review.name: Lack of engineering.
comment:
Hello,

Thank you for reaching out to us and taking the time to provide feedback on our RoadTrip Swaptop Cast Iron Grill Grate,We apologize for your negative experience with our product. We work passionately to achieve such satisfaction from our customers by continuously improving our products and services. As we are looking for ways to better our product and service, we always ensure that consumers' feedback and concerns are shared with the concerned department.

Should you have Further questions please visit our Coleman website, click on the question mark logo in the upper right corner, select contact us, and you will be directed to our contact form so we can determine the best resolution. Have a great day!. Thank you very much, and have a wonderful day!. Thank you and have a great day

review.reviewBody: 100% better than the original aluminum grill that melted on me while trying to boil some water.

review.itemreviewed: Summit Chamlang Soft Shell Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: I got the Futurelight pants as soon as they came out and I loved them. This is my second pair and I am not totally sold. The pants are still very waterproof and breathable, which I love. However, I have some thoughts. 1. Not a fan of one front pocket instead of two 2. Bottom is way too tapered and barely fit over the snowboard boot unless you open the zipper. 3. said zipper is in the back so the only way to use these with StepOn bindings is to force the bottoms sideways I will use these skiing, but too much hassle to use them with my snowboard boots
review.name: Great tech pants with room for improvements on the cut

review.name: Best ice climbing pant I found

review.itemreviewed: Summit Chamlang Soft Shell Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: This is a very functional light fleece. But because I also own the Black Diamond Factor Hoody, and I run cold, that is what I grab 99% of the time. I love the waist pockets on the Factor and the extra warmth it provides. It’s more functional for me. But if you’re looking for ultra lightweight fleece then this is definitely for you.
review.name: Solid light fleece

review.reviewBody: A good top for layering, which is warm and light. The only comment is that I felt the sizing runs a little big, especially since the arms are really wide. I'm normally a medium in most things black diamond and this felt pretty baggy, so next time I'd for a small (5ft 6, 140lbs). Colour is great.
review.name: Great layering

review.reviewBody: Awesome, comfy layer. I liked the first one I had so much I bought a second color. Great as an uphill layer for backcountry skiing.
review.name: So great I bought 2

review.reviewBody: I love the long torso on this jacket. It makes it great for biking so that even when I'm leaned over on the bike, there's no gapping in the back. The small fits me perfectly (I'm 5'8" and 135lb). Love the hoody for when it's a little to chilly at the start of a run and the long sleeves with thumb loops. My only complaint is that the material is a bit scratchy. It's not the cozy hoody you want to cuddle up in due to the scratchy material but it is very functional to wick moisture and keep you warm while you're outside doing stuff.
review.name: great fit and function

review.reviewBody: The quality of every aspect in this coefficient hoody is just what I need for my outdoor activities.
review.name: Great overall

review.reviewBody: I don’t know how this hoody never caught my eye before, but I’m so glad I ordered it with my latest haul. It’s soft and light, the blue is beautiful, and the fit is flattering. I’m usually a size small, and this runs true to size. I have wider hips and this fits comfortably. I wish it had hand pockets, but I imagine not having them it keeps it lighter and more streamlined with a harness.
review.name: So glad I ordered it!

review.reviewBody: This is my new favorite layer. At the crag or on the snow. This layer has been great! I love the texture inside and how comfortable and breathable it is. The hood works great over my climbing helmet and the thumb loops are my favorite. I am a solid size medium and the medium fit great. The chest pocket fit my guide notebook and a pencil perfect. I didn’t even notice there weren’t hand pockets. As my outermost layer on warmer windy days or a mid-layer, this is my new go to!
review.name: New favorite!

review.reviewBody: The Azurite color is great in person! This has become a touring and spring climbing staple for me. I want one in every color!
review.name: Great fit and color

review.reviewBody: Great color and fit. Wish there were additional pockets lower, but love this for climbing
review.name: Great color and fit. Wish

review.reviewBody: It's a little roomy, but I think I'm just in between sizes. Overall this is a warm yet breathable piece that will be great for hiking during shoulder seasons. And just wearing around.
review.name: Super comfortable

name: Coefficient Fleece Hooded Jacket - Women's

review.name: Size Chart Wrong

review.reviewBody: I ordered a pair of size 46 shoes and they fit just as expected.  I was able to mount the cleat where I wanted and all fit into position.  The ratchet was new to me as these replaced a 10-year-old set of shoes, but after a couple to rides to tune in the proper tension, they are becoming a natural.  Overall, a good experience.
review.name: Nice shoes at a good price

review.reviewBody:
I haven’t bought shoes in about 10 years, was using my triathlon shoes for the road bike because they were so stiff I got a new bike, and decided to get new shoes.
I love them, they fit my narrow foot, and are very stiff
review.name: Nice shoe

review.reviewBody: The F1 XT is so light and walks and climbs so well! I love it for the big days going deep in the backcountry well beyond all the tracks. It makes it easy to get thos big days and missions done and drives a mid sized ski no problem (172-183 length by 80-105 width) It seems to fit average feet and the forward lean adjustment allows for a more forward adjustment over the older F1 LT. If you want a boot that is light and walks almost as good as a race boot yet totally rips steep descents, then this is your ticket to a ton of great skiing!

review.reviewBody: Poor quality, The has several holes.
review.name: Patagonia should be ashamed!

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Graphic Long-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody:
First of all, to the reviewer below: If you get a defective item, just call Backcountry for an exchange.  Stuff happens, you know?
Now, as for these shirts:  The fabric is just wonderful for those hot Summer days when you need sun protection but want something gossamer to stay cool.  And half the graphic colorways are really interesting.  I have two of these and already have my eye on a third colorway.  Since I am not skinny around the middle, I find the Patagucci trim fit tight on me; so I go up one size and achieve just the fit I'm seeking.  Like most Patagucci items these badboys aren't cheap; but like all Pataguccis, they are worth every penny.
review.name: Perfecto!

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Graphic Long-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
Capilene Cool Daily Graphic Long-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have used these shirts for everything: running in hot temps, backpacking for several days, hanging around the house, layering under warmer layers for comfort. Love this material, sun protection, and fit.
review.name: I want a closet full of these

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Graphic Long-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Nice long-sleeve T for summer outdoor activities. It dries out quickly. 
Size perfect fits.
However, i purchase 3 different color/design and one of them is broken when i received it. 
The left arm has several holes. Disappointing.
review.name: Broken

review.reviewBody: Awesome shell. Good fit. Breathable and waterproof. Zipper is better than previous years.
review.name: Best one yet!

review.reviewBody: Overall the jacket feels really good and fits comfortability. This is my second shell from OR, the other being a foray 2. In comparison to the foray 2 it is definitely a bit burlier and a tad bit more crinkly. This is a 3l jacket so it's not going to be as soft as something like the foray 2. It feels very similar to a Beta AR in terms of rigidness but with a tad bit softer exterior. The construction is quality and I like the placement of the pockets. When the hood is not over the head I find it sits kind of awkwardly on the back of the neck. Hopefully, as I break the jacket in the hood will lay a bit flatter. I am 5'9 155lbs and the medium fits perfect and leaves plenty of room for layering. I was looking for a "do it all" shell and this fits the bill. I think this jacket will cover all bases for me from hiking to skiing and I can't wait to see how it performs.
review.name: Great Fit!

review.reviewBody: This jacket feels good. Nice attention to detail. The sleeves are a *titch* short for me, but I have long arms. I'm 6'2", 185lbs, with a 32" inseam. Room for a puffy underneath.
review.name: Headwall Works

review.reviewBody: Excellent product. Perfect color...easily visible. My problem:  No way to secure roll and secure hood when it isn't up.
review.name: Great Color, but...

review.reviewBody: This was a Warranty Exchange for a jacket that is no longer made. OR generously offered 2 replacements, (the other was longer), this jacket is excellent in the rain, stylish, fit is perfect, and’ll be great bombing down the slopes.
review.name: Top Dawg

review.reviewBody: Solid jacket. Love the pocket locations. Put zips are great for air flow. And of course the material is top notch. I use this jacket daily for commuting on my bike in San Francisco’s cold fog. The yellow color is great because it helps me be seen. I also use the jacket for skiing. It’s my perfect hard shell.
review.name: Love the jacket

review.reviewBody: Excellent jacket, except the fit is for tall, thin built people. I am short and stocky and the fit is not as good as other companies jackets.

This “do-it-all” gote-tex shell is just what I was looking for! The jacket is cut very well and fits great on an athletic frame. I bought a large, and my measurements are 6ft, 43.5in chest, and 34in waist. It is not too bulky and not too tight. I really like the placement/size of the four exterior pockets. The jacket is very light weight and is ideal for backcountry trips. It should also be durable enough for resort skiing. What I like most about this jacket is that it looks good enough that I will wear it around town during heavy-rain commutes. The hood fits my large helmet without complaint. OR did a great job designing this shell. I tried on many other brands before choosing this shell. Other brands are simply cut too bulky in the waist. I have not had a chance to put the jacket to use, but winter is coming..

My only real complaints are the lack of any interior pockets, and no RECCO reflector.
review.name: A Do-It-All Jacket!

name: Headwall GORE-TEX 3L Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Haven’t used them much this season yet, but they seem sturdy, they’re not too heavy, and fit even inside my small pack. 
Like them so far.
review.name: So far so good

review.reviewBody: Used them my first time splitboarding and they helped me out of a bind! easy to set up and feel really durable, looking forward to using them for years to come!
review.name: Great poles!

review.reviewBody: Love the portability and performance at a solid price. They’re sturdy, easy to pack, and perfect for ski or backcountry trips
review.name: Great product and great discount

review.reviewBody: Just got to use these piles for the first time yesterday to go split boarding. Have to say I was a bit skeptical at how sturdy they could be. After a day of use, including REALLY wrenching on them to pull myself out of some deep snow I have complete confidence in these poles. And they are super compact when broken down. Really really convenient to pack away and convenient to pull back out and put together. Super happy
review.name: Just got to use these

review.reviewBody: Light compact and easy to expand and so far so good just need more pow
review.name: Splitboard poles

review.reviewBody: These are great poles for split boarding. They fit in my tiny backpack
review.name: Amazing poles

review.reviewBody: Bought these recently to split board. They work great. Took me a minute to realize that I had to pull the middle until it clicked to lock them into place, but once I got them figured out they did exactly what I needed them to do
review.name: Poles do the job for ski touring

review.reviewBody: They are super light, compact and easy to assemble. Would definitely recommend for your next backcountry adventure!
review.name: Perfect for Splitboarding!

review.reviewBody: I've used these exclusively for splitboard touring, they are the only way to go. They could be more durable but I can't live without them.
review.name: The only pole for splitboarders

review.reviewBody: These poles do it all!! Such versatility, such light weight (relatively), and great strength.
review.name: AT, Side Country, and Resort!!

review.reviewBody: Sooo gorgeous but there’s a piece in the back that rubs at the heel and it’s sooo painful, literally cannot wear these boots for more than 20 mins.
comment: Hello Dia, we want to extend our apologies concerning your experience. We pride ourselves in maintaining the highest quality standards for our customers and apologize we missed the mark here.

review.reviewBody: I wore them once and the rubber on them was scuffed and started flaking.  Additionally, Rubbed and irritated the skin on my leg.
review.name: Cute but poor quality, uncomfortable
comment: Hello Sasha, we want to extend our apologies concerning your experience. We pride ourselves in maintaining the highest quality standards for our customers and apologize we missed the mark here.

review.reviewBody: Great boots and glad I added them to Sorel collection of footwear! Despite some saying these are too narrow, my foot is slightly wide and fit fine.  Normal to be snug at first and with light/medium sock were fine as shown in pic.  Perfect boots for TX cold/wet winters and super cute.
review.name: Unique cute boots

review.reviewBody: These boots are really cute but so uncomfortable.  I love my Sorel products but this did not do it for me comfort wise.  They actually gave me blisters.
review.name: Not comfortable
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our support team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.reviewBody: I got these boots because I liked the uniqueness of the sole, they are waterproof, and something that I could hopefully wear in a multitude of Midwest USA conditions.  I purchased my normal Sorel size (these are my 3rd pair).  The first time I wore them was on a 2 mile outdoor winter lights walk and I was a but nervous that I hadn't broken them in yet.  Absolutely no issues! These were so comfortable and my feet were warm without being hot. Fabulous boots.
review.name: Shockingly comfortable on day 1.

review.reviewBody:
definitely trust the reviews regarding sizing, especially if you have a wider foot. I am usually size 9. I had to return and get a size 9.5— much better. 

I was looking for a waterproof shoe that was also stylish and edgie—  this is definitely that. Love them so far now that I sized up a little. They could be a little bit more comfortable, but I wouldn’t call them uncomfortable. I’m keeping them :)
review.name: Overall really cute, edgie boot

review.reviewBody: How do they do it? So stylish and so comfortable. All weather boots that look HOT.
review.name: Obsessed

review.reviewBody: These boots are comfortable, stylish, and waterproof to boot!  They are perfect for running errands in Minnesota in fall, winter, and spring!  I bought them last year in olive green and loved them so much I bought them in the black, too!
review.name: Stylish and comfy!

review.reviewBody: Very cool shoe but so much more red than the pictures. They would be really awesome if the red was brown. They are also tight in the toes.
review.name: Beautiful shoe wish they were more brown and comfortable.
comment: Hello Diane, we want to extend our sincerest apologies concerning this issue. We pride ourselves in maintaining the highest quality standards for our customers and apologize we missed the mark here.

review.reviewBody: Absolutely love these boots. They are warm, waterproof and I love the Brex style. Have a few pairs and I’m happy with them all ❤️
review.name: The Cutest Winter Boot

review.reviewBody: My little guy loves this trailer for our riding and running adventures!
review.name: My little guy loves this

review.reviewBody: This was a baby shower gift. The baby is due in Oct. A review is not possible now.
review.name: This was a baby shower

review.reviewBody: Love it! Quality product. My 1 year old loves riding in it.
review.name: Quality product

review.reviewBody: It may sound silly, but now that we have the Burley Encore X, I find our 6 mile ride on the bike path to "school" to be the highlight of my day. Our 10 month old is happy and content relaxing in the sunshine on his way to "see the ladies." Thank you, Burley! My wife and I are thrilled!
review.name: I look forward to our rides to daycare!

review.reviewBody: The trailer is high quality, fills the family’s needs. It has more storage than I initially thought. It folds down VERY flat. I recommend it!
review.name: Great solution for my family!

review.reviewBody: So excited to start using it more. Worked great to carry cargo and my senior pup on our skiing adventure.
review.name: So excited to start using

review.reviewBody: This product was a Christmas present for my daughter and her family. They really like this product to take the children on bike rides.
review.name: Encore X

review.reviewBody: Amazing product. So happy with the Burley Encore, and my daughter loves it as well!
review.name: LOVE THE BURLEY ENCORE

review.reviewBody:
So happy I went with this purchase! The trailer is truly burley. We’ve used it primarily as a jogger but have the bike and ski setups as well. It’s incredibly smooth, quiet and secure on both gravel or bumpy trails. It’s the only carrier that our baby immediately falls asleep in. It keeps her warm even on cold winter condition days, particularly so as we layered blankets throughout. There so much storage space in the back too. 

I went with the two seater despite having one kid (as of now) and glad I did so it grows with our family. 

We bought the infant insert for our 4 month old and ended up waiting a bit longer to use it even with the insert given the seat tilts her forward a bit. At six months now we are definitely still going to use it for a while given her smaller size to add some cushion. I

 don’t have the stroller wheels but assume those would help the wide turning radius if I was trying to navigate the grocery store - I use our other stroller for errands because of that. 

I thought I’d want the 16” wheels for our gravel trail but I don’t think we’ll use them after all. 

As an active person prior to having kids this has really helped me start to feel like me again! Thank you, Burley!
review.name: A must have for active parents

review.reviewBody:
It’s great. So much easier to push through gravel. All the little issues on my 30 year old burley have been resolved. I like the hub break. The sun shade. That I can take it out all weather. Easy to change from jogger to trailer.
I do wish the seat reclined as the baby falls asleep in it. So will have to put a pillow next to him and try a neck pillow. Attaching to the hitch is much better than the old attachment. We haven’t tried the little dogs i. With the baby, but I think that will work. We will put a dog bed in the storage area for them. How the screen cover closed with the straps and “D” rings is so much easier than the snaps.
review.name: It’s great. So much easier

name: Encore X Stroller

review.reviewBody: Highly breathable pants while still being sufficiently durable. As a man with an athletic build, I really appreciate the fit of Marmot. These pants fit great and look great.
review.name: Breathable, waterproof and an athletic fit.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wish they had pockets. There’s only one about mid-leg, but it’s not big enough to carry more than a set of keys and maybe a wallet.
review.name: Pretty good but need more pockets

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] 10/10 - Great performance, Great fit - No Complaints! Would love for Marmot to put out short leg length options in addition to regular and tall.
review.name: Great performance, Great fit, Short length request

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] One of the standout features of these pants is the combination of durable GORE-TEX 3L and lightweight GORE-TEX Active materials. This blend not only ensures exceptional durability but also keeps the pants light, allowing for efficient movement in the mountains. The lightweight construction is particularly advantageous during hikes, as it minimizes fatigue and allows for unrestricted mobility.

The complete waterproofing of these pants is another feature that I greatly appreciate. Regardless of the weather conditions, I can confidently rely on the GORE-TEX technology to keep me dry and comfortable. Whether it's a light drizzle or a heavy downpour, these pants provide reliable protection against moisture. It's worth noting that if you plan to wear them over clothing, it's recommended to order a size up for a proper fit.

In terms of fit, the elastic waist belt and ankle zippers allow for easy customization. I can adjust the pants to my preferred fit, ensuring optimal comfort throughout my outdoor activities. The zippered pockets are also a convenient addition, providing ample space to stash small gear such as keys, a map, or a phone.

Furthermore, the packability of these pants is worth highlighting. They are extremely lightweight and can be easily compressed, making them a fantastic choice for backpacking or traveling. The ability to pack them down into a small size without sacrificing performance is a huge plus.

In summary, the Men's GORE-TEX® Mitre Peak Pant is a versatile and reliable choice for outdoor enthusiasts. Their complete waterproofing, lightweight construction, and packability make them perfect for hiking and other outdoor activities. Whether you're braving wet conditions or looking for comfortable and functional pants, these are an excellent option. I highly recommend them to anyone seeking durable, lightweight, and versatile pants for their adventures.
review.name: Versatile and Reliable

review.reviewBody: so far they are GREAT...Hiked twice and very durable, lightweight and non-restrictive....and look GREAT....if temps get below 50 degrees, will have to wear insulated leggings.....only complaint is why there is only ONE pocket....???....needs at LEAST one more pocket...size large is perfect for me, adjustable integrated belt works very well...am 180 lbs. at 5ft. 9.5 inches tall.....got them on sale for $209.99....think they will last a very long time....so comfortable ....wear anywhere...most i EVER spent on ANY pants....but they are very quality built
review.name: Marmot Mitre Peak Pant

name: Mitre Peak Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: I wear Solomon's for work but have never purchased a pair for personal use until now. I bought these shoes for trail running and they were perfect. The provided extra cushion, ankle support, and grip.
review.name: Fantastic Shoe!

review.reviewBody: Best trail shoe ever. Extremely comfortable (and cushy) out of the box and the 8mm drop is just perfect. Super grippy and light, making it a great choice for long technical trail runs. The best feature though, is the support  from the active chassis. This shoe is a must-have.
review.name: Top Favorite Trail Shoe

review.reviewBody: Not a big fan of any of the color choices. Favorite shoe for trail running otherwise.
review.name: Not a fan of the colors

review.reviewBody: Would be a favorite... but is with the poor color choices for the women's Genesis? Very lacking in color choices for women! Recommend to have different color choices. The men's version has better colors. (Meanwhile the women's choices of Black/Sulphur Spring/Orchid Petal and Carbon/Grisaille/Aloe Wash colors are kinda ugly)
review.name: Good shoe but NEEDS MORE COLORS

review.reviewBody: At last, probably the best trail shoes I’ve ever had - and I’ve had loads over many decades! So comfy and versatile perfect for all terrains - hardpacked trails, mud, squelchy grass, slippery rocks, stony paths, gravel - what fantastic grip! Light but cushioned, wide toe box, nicely responsive. I use Salomon Speedcross for really muddy trails, and these are perfect for all other kinds of surfaces and terrain. Highly recommend.
review.name: Perfect,versatile trail shoe for all surfaces

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, narrow (which is great for my feet), and durable enough to handle the trails. Highly recommend for anyone trying to do sub-ultra trail running/training.
review.name: Comfortable + Durable = Great Trail Shoe
comment: Hi, thank you for sharing your experience with us. We always strive to improve! Your feedback has been helpful for us!

review.reviewBody: I was choosing between these shoes and the Glides to start training/racing ultra trail races. I ultimately chose this shoe because I live on the East Coast and most trails I run on are rocky. I also went a half size bigger than my road shoe size because I found my feet swelling more on long trail runs than long road runs, and I had a lot of toe jamming issues. These shoes are versatile, the toe box is stiff, and although I was worried about my foot slipping around inside the shoe, I feel like these shoes provide the perfect balance of stable yet let me feet do what they need to do. The shoes handle well on technical trail, gravel, uphill, and through a variety of rocks, including big, slippery rocks. The hideaway laces are a nice feature as well.
review.name: Overall Great for Mixed Terrains!

review.reviewBody: I was happily surprised that the green color wasn’t too distracting. The shoes fit amazingly well and were truly very comfortable
review.name: Gen shoes

review.reviewBody:
might run a little big, but i’ll never know because you can’t return once they’re worn.  shoes always feel
different running vs just walking around the house.  almost all other shoe companies let you run in them and still return.  only bummer about Salomon.
review.name: wish Salomon allowed wear testing
comment: Hello, we genuinely value your input. We regret that we were unable to give you the best choice at this time. As we always make adjustments to be better and be able to provide the finest customer service possible, we'll keep your instance in mind.

review.reviewBody: The grip! That's what sold me on these shoes! They are by far the best soles I have experienced on a Salomon shoe. Great on all terrain, I even feel more confident on wet roots though there is no shoe on earth that can save you from a slippery tree root on a wet day! I run a lot and I run long. These never let me down. I recommend these shoes to every trail runner I meet.
review.name: Wow!

name: Genesis Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These shorts are super comfortable and stylish - versatile enough to dress up or dress down with, they've quickly become a go-to in my closet.
review.name: Love these versatile shorts

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Light weight fabric.  Great fit and length is perfect
review.name: Nice Product

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Lightweight, just the right length, smooth, feeling, and very comfortableI
review.name: Most comfortable shorts

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the comfort and feel of these shorts. I love all the pockets and the color is dead on.
review.name: Comfort fit and looks

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these ... light weight comfy and cool, plus my wife says I look great in them
review.name: Looking good !

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] As always, Columbia has great products.  These shorts are fashionable, comfortable and exactly as advertised.  Great fit, true to size.  I am a shorter guy, and I love that Columbia gives you inseam choices on shorts.
review.name: Great Shorts!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good shorts, true to size. Wish they came in more colors
review.name: Good shorts

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good shorts, true to size. Wish they came in more colors
review.name: Good shorts

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Columbia model pictures are deceiving in regards to the product fit. I ordered one in each color and I'm very disappointed that I can no longer trust the pictures on this website. I always wear a Medium in bottoms no matter the brand but these fit me huge like a Large or bigger and these are supposed to be the body skimming active fit. This past week I came across a pair of expensive shorts I purchased from another brand years ago and I was surprised at the difference in size when I laid them on top of the other. When I laid the Columbia short on top of the other brand same size I couldn't see them. When I laid the other brand shorts on top of these Columbia shorts I just couldn't believe it. I returned two coats and two vests this past winter because they were too big. Either Columbia has a sizing problem or they target demographic are getting even more obese. I don't think I've ever left a review on this website and if I did it must have been over 10 years ago. I returned to order them in a size Small because I like the salmon color. I think I'm going to have to accept that this brand's sizing is deceptive and generous to put it nicely. One thing for sure is they don't fit like the guy's on the pictures.
review.name: Deceptive Pictures of Product Fit
comment: We are sorry to hear your experience was less than stellar! We would love the opportunity to make things right, please reach out to our Customer Care support team for further assistance!

review.reviewBody: Looks and feels great. Stylish and comfortable. Perfect for Summertime
review.name: Fresh look

name: PFG Uncharted 6in Short - Men's

description: Buy the Thule Range Bike Rack - 4 Bike online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Range Bike Rack - 4 Bike
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Range Bike Rack - 4 Bike online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Overpriced **** rack, can only fit one out of my 4 mountains bike it’s not freaking rocket science guys, one more inch of space inside would of made the difference, bad design
review.name: Not made for mountain bikes

review.reviewBody: We have it on the back of our RV, and I have to stop multiple times to tighten the nut because it gets very loose and then the bikes really jump around
review.name: Loosen easily.

review.reviewBody: This rack is just what I needed to haul the families bikes on the back of our RV. It bolts up solid and holds the bikes in place without worry and the integrated cable lock is a bonus.
review.name: My Bikes are at home on the Range

review.reviewBody: Got this to haul our mtb bikes across country on the back of our GD Reflection 5th wheel. Worked great ! Very well made, sturdy bike rack. Did 3400 mile trip cross country with no issues. I was able to mount my full suspension Stumpjumper on the rack as is but would have been easier with the top cross bar adapter.
review.name: Strong and Sturdy Bike Rack

review.reviewBody: Great rack. Would like to see the bolt in the adapter being a little more secure. It managed to wiggle loose even after second re-torque. Otherwise love it.
review.name: Great rack

review.reviewBody: The arms snapped dumping my bikes on the road at 55mph.  Looked like poor welds as one side was cleanly broke.  I wouldn’t trust this product behind trailer.  And the straps come loose too.  Added extra Velcro straps.
review.name: Don’t use!!!  Rack failed!!!

review.reviewBody: It’s a heavy duty bike rack, I installed it to the Thor Gemini motor home, plan to put the bikes on and test drive it, but I have not gotten a chance to drive it.  Will update after the test drive.
review.name: Solid 2 inches bike rack

review.reviewBody:
If you have conventional bike frames this rack would work great, problem is with the new swept frame designs they won’t fit over the two support arms.
Out of 5 of my family bikes only one will fit.
Very disappointing.
Quality of the unit is good.
review.name: The rack won’t fit most of my bikes!
comment:
Thank you for sharing your thoughts on the Thule Range. I'm sorry to hear your bikes were not compatible with this bike rack. 
It sounds like you may need a set of Thule Frame Adapters to provide the flat top tube needed to mount a bike to a hanging bike rack. These adapters are often needed for step-through, full-suspension, or other bike styles that lack a flat top tube.

review.reviewBody: Used this for 2 hybrid bikes and after driving on hiway for 30 minutes two of the straps are almost off.
review.name: Straps come loose

review.reviewBody: Wow, best of the best of the best!  The key is the two inch insertion bar!  All the combined components lock tight in place! If you have a camper and want a hitch, this is the best bang for the buck.  I no longer worry about my bikes bouncing on the back of my fifth wheel.  Great Job Thule!
review.name: Fits like a Glove!

name: Range Bike Rack - 4 Bike

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Recently purchased for the ski season. Fits true to size and works well as an outer layer / shell.
review.name: Nice Shell!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] With the warmer winter we've resulted in a few raining ski days. 3/4 through the day my jacket was soaked through the arms and shoulders. This happened 2 twice. My gloves, pants were dry!
review.name: Jacket Is Not Waterproof

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Traded in a goretex summit series for future light. Initial feelings are less pliable than goretex but feels like it could take more punishment. Snowboarded in it though cut like an alpining shell. Need to layer beneath it
review.name: So far, so good?

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good coat... wish there were more pockets
review.name: Good, could use more pockets

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I think this is a great hardshell jacket for extreme conditions. I am 5.8 and I bought small. but sleeves are still too long. And it's hard to use hoody without wearing helmet. so overall it is great but not for daily using.
review.name: Great jacket but!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great movement for a mountaineering jacket. The heat zips work well and are easy to use while wearing gloves.
review.name: Best jacket for comfort while on the mountain.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this jacket, cant wait to try it out in real life this winter. I am not sure what insulating layer to pair it with, I have a Nuptse and it seems to fit under this for very cold weather, not sure tho.
review.name: Great but needs to be paired with a nice mid layer.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Jacket looks really hi quality, looking forward to testing it this winter with layers for warmth.
review.name: yes

review.reviewBody: No complaints! First shell I’ve owned that I don’’t feel stuffy in during heavy activity. The Chamlang breathes extremely well. Sizing is perfect. The sleeves are a little on the long side, but when used as an outer most layer the extra length gets taken up. Hood fits nice over a helmet and cinches up great over it as well. Super light weight and packable.
review.name: Killer Shell

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] After 40 minutes of wearing it in the rain, the jacket leaks! The shoulders are wet!
review.name: Waterproof

name: Summit Chamlang FUTURELIGHT Jacket - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Tivoli V Parc WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Not sure if I will ever need this boots with SC weather but they were perfect for a trip to Chicago!
review.name: Amazing!

review.itemreviewed: Tivoli V Parc WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these for my wife and she loves them. They are warm, look great and very comfortable.
review.name: Cute Boots

review.itemreviewed: Tivoli V Parc WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are some of the cutest boots I’ve ever seen! They are quite comfy and really keep my feet warm. I can’t wait to wear them all winter. I sized up a half size just to accommodate for thick socks
review.name: Love the look, feel, and fit!!!

review.itemreviewed: Tivoli V Parc WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really like these boots. They’re cute, for one. They would go with a ton of outfits. I really like the neutral color scheme and how they picked browns that will go with a lot of different colors. These are really functional boots, and can go from every day wear to being used heavily outdoors. They also have a nice wait to them without being too heavy. The overall comfort of the boot is pretty great. I will say that they could definitely, add some arch support, but the boots do wear down nicely and fit to the shape of you. I haven’t tried the waterproof features, but these do seem really durable and hardy. I live in a cold state, so these are super warm and wonderful for the winter. I’m glad I have these for the upcoming winter, because the cold months are always such a struggle for me. If you do not live in a cold state, I could see how these would make you overheat. I do recommend these overall and think that they are pretty good value for money. When you consider the amount of wears that you would get from such a hard shoe, I think the price definitely works itself out.
review.name: Warm and perfect for winter

review.itemreviewed: Tivoli V Parc WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These beautifully crafted boots fit me very snug and cuddly! Instantly fell In love with the support and comfy wool material inside boot. Highly recommended designer!
review.name: Warm and cuddly definitely an attention grabber this winter!

review.itemreviewed: Tivoli V Parc WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Tivoli V Parc women’s waterproof Boot looks so gorgeous very good quality fits perfectly very warm great for fall and best part waterproof and top of all very comfortable I love them specially this color goes with most of my outfits love it
review.name: Very comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Tivoli V Parc WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got these in the summer, so I can't actually test how warm and waterproof they would be for their intended use. However, they feel so good on the feet. The sheepskin feels real and soft, just like what UGG used to feel like before they started using artificial fur. These remind me so much of the UGG Adirondack boot. I'm actually excited for winter so that I could use these.
review.name: UGG Adirondack Dupes

review.itemreviewed: Tivoli V Parc WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Just right size and comfortable on.  These are a little heavy to wear but the material is durable.  There is some cushion and they feel slip-proof.
review.name: Excellent Fall or Winter Shoe Especially for Vacation

review.itemreviewed: Tivoli V Parc WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Tivoli V Parc Women waterproof boot is amazing my mom wore a size 7 and says they are soft comfortable warm but felt a little heavy . Very durable and have good traction to keep you from slipping falling during cold winter months. Highly recommended. True to size . Well made and pretty !
review.name: Superior boots !

review.itemreviewed: Tivoli V Parc WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very comfortable snow boots. True to size, I got them for my wife. It has the perfect support for the feet and body posture. Traction is great. The materials are high quality which makes these boots very durable and comfortable.
review.name: Perfect winter weather boots

name: Tivoli V Parc WP Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: I followed the size chart after measuring my hand and once I received the mittens, I wish I would have sized down. The mittens were so big that they flew off one of my hands at the end of the tow rope. Otherwise, they are incredibly warm and kept my hands dry.
review.name: Super warm, runs big

review.reviewBody: It was time for a new pair of warm mittens for both playing outside with kids and other outdoor activities. These mittens fit great and are nice and warm. The part I love most is the wrist cord (not sure of the technical term) that keeps them on my wrist even when I need to take them off my hands to help kids or when my hands are too warm. Never need to worry about loosing a mitten or trying to hold them and do another task. If you are thinking about getting these mittens do it!!
review.name: Love these mittens!!

hasVariant.name: Swift 500 Headlight
hasVariant.description: Buy the NiteRider Swift 500 Headlight online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Does not hold a charge.
I rarely ride in the dark. When I do ride in the dark I really need to be able to count on my light. This light never held a a charge long enough to be useful to me. 

I had to ride 4 and half miles home from shop where I got my trike weldedNot having use this late and while it was completely dead, or so I plugged it into charge it overnight& or so I thought. When I got to the shop that afternoon slow it was completely dead. I had to get a much smaller emergency light. Soon after starting home it began pouring rain, and getting very dark. This light sure would have been helpful.
review.name: No. Does not hold a charge.

name: Swift 500 Headlight

review.reviewBody: I had a pair of these from about 10 years ago and the soles finally wore through so I ordered another pair 3XL, (I wear a size 14 shoe) same as what I had before. I loved these slippers for around the house and for winter camping. Like a down coat for each foot, very nice and warm. I was very disappointed when I got my new ones. They didn't appear to be made as well as my old pair and were much too small. Laying the soles together with the new and old, the new ones were 1 1/2 inches smaller. Both were 3XL.  I could fit into them with my toes curled, not comfortable at all. I sent them back and put new soles on my old pair with shoegoo.
review.name: Not what they used to be

review.reviewBody: These booties are very comfy and warm. Wore them around in -20F ambient temp with -45F windchill and had nice warm feet! Only reason not 5 stars is they don't compress very well to save pack space; although in all fairness i did not try a compression bag, I just rolled them up and stuffed into any area they would fit.
review.name: Comfy and warm

name: Cush Booty Hybrid Slipper

review.reviewBody: Bought for my nephew who’s new to hiking and it fits his needs perfectly
review.name: Head lamp

review.reviewBody: Good quality as always from black diamond. Quite bright for 300 lumen
review.name: Astro 300-r rechargeable head lamp

review.reviewBody: This headlamp broke me out (I am allergic to nickel), and I now have a dime sized scar on the center of my forehead from contact to my skin. The light itself and recharging capability is great. However, the base plate has two small screws within it that contain nickel. Do not recommend if you have an allergy. Please make a headlamp without the screws so I can use them.
review.name: Screws in base plate contain nickel 👎

review.reviewBody:
Had this headlamp for less than a year and now it won’t charge.. because I don’t have the receipt anymore they will not help troubleshoot the problem and only offer a 40% coupon - one, the product broke within a year and two they don’t stand behind their product when a customer owns it - thing still looks brand new but won’t charge! 

Plenty of other brands to choose from - look at reddit forums of people who had the same issues!
review.name: Stay away from Black Diamond products!!!

review.reviewBody: So much beter than throwing batteries in my old hobby work light!!!!!
review.name: Great headlamp!!!!!

review.reviewBody: Well built, light-weight headlamp that has a powerful beam that you can adjust by just holding the button which fades the brightness down and up to get the exact level desired. Built in batter lasts a long time. Two thumbs up!
review.name: Compact, light, and bright headlamp

review.reviewBody: My headlamp is very bright and I appreciate the dimmer switch feature and the rechargeable lithium battery. It would have been nice to have the red light feature for night work, but that feature doesn't come with this model. Overall satisfied with my purchase.
review.name: Good basic unit

review.reviewBody: The adjustment settings are easy to use and give lots of good options, it’s lightweight, and brighter than headlamps I’ve used in the past.
review.name: Lightweight, practical

review.reviewBody: not only is this lamp very easy to use, but this lamp is BRIGHT. I use this headlamp for my evening runs, early morning hikes and whatever other activities that require a good quality headlamp. I love it.
review.name: BEST LAMP EVER

review.reviewBody: Too heavy and big. I preferred the Iota which is no longer available.
review.name: Iota was much better

name: Astro 300-R Headlamp

Please fix your mistakes and not make it so cheap! 
Thank you

It's not for daily wear because it is so good. Only mountain wear or in the high plains in winter when it is 20 below and wind chills of 30 or 40 below. It is worth it if you can afford it.
review.name: I would buy again.

review.reviewBody: I absolute LOVE my Anaya boots. My first pair lasted 5 years. Unbelievably comfortable. But since I was looking for a flatter boot, I order the Rowena. There is no cushioning in the footbed that I can detect. Toe box and everything else fits perfectly and I love the look. When I am on a business trip, I'm walking 6-8 miles a day. I don't think this will offer the same level of comfort. Really sad.
review.name: Don't understand the footbed

review.reviewBody: I love my Teva sandals. However, my first foray into a Teva boot was not successful. The toe was too narrow. The boot is beautiful and I was very bummed out that I had to return them.
review.name: Hve been a Teva fan for decades. This is too narrow

review.reviewBody: The Rowena is very hard material and most uncomfortable Teva I have ever purchased. I returned them. Don't buy unless you can try them on in person at a store, I trusted that all Teva's were the most comfortable ever but Rowena is not! Would give it no stars but had to give it at least one in order to post.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: I usually wear wide widths, so I was pleasantly surprised at how comfortable these were. If I get another pair of boots from this company, I will definitely go up a half size to 9.5, because they were a little tight when worn with thicker socks.
review.name: Super Comfortable Even for Wide Feet

review.reviewBody: Comfy as bedroom slippers. Can wear them anywhere -- even the airport where you walk a mile. No problem! Also water resistant which is great.
review.name: My third pair of Teva boots. Love them.

review.reviewBody: Love this boot. Good quality, comfortable and you can dress up or down. The fit is a little bit more on the loose end. I'm usually a size 7 but would have gone with a 6.5 if I had known. However, even with a slightly loose fit I still love this boot and have it in both black and bison colors.
review.name: Great boot!

review.reviewBody: Several years ago I bought this style and it felt like butter! So comfortable, the sole was soft too. This version had a hard insole as well as outer sole. It also ran big.
review.name: Disappointed with this boot

review.reviewBody: Very happy with these boots! Fit is slightly bigger than other Teva boots I have had in same size, but not enough to down size even 1/2 a size for me. These were more comfortable than I expected even without adding insoles which I typically do. They are versatile and have really good tread. I live in a warm climate, but use these for traveling in colder/wetter climates. They were my main pair of footwear for 2 week trip to Ireland in Oct. Kept feet warm, dry and comfortable.
review.name: Great boots

review.reviewBody: This year's version seems to run REALLY big. I have been a devout buyer of their waterproof boots for years, and was looking to replace a pair from 2 years ago. I ordered an 8.5 and the boots that arrived were at least a 9 or maybe even 9.5. I held up the bottom of the new boots to compare against the old version, and yeah, the toe was maybe .75-1" longer? Not sure what sizing they are using this year but I would start out with a half size down. But the quality - amazing. You can't get a better, comfortable attractive boot that's both leather and weatherproof than Teva boots.
review.name: Love Teva boots but...

review.reviewBody: I wanted a pair of boots that were stylish but I could also hike through the woods with and I found them. Super cute with a pair of jeans or leggings. 10/10 would totally recommend
review.name: Super cute and comfy!

name: Rowena Buckle Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody:
These are a well made pair of mittens.  I ordered them in 11 based on my hand measurement at 10.5  They are super warm.  Haven't tested out the water resistance.  I marked them as "Runs Small" for product fit.  They are perfect on my left hand but on my right, they are very snug where my thumb attaches to my hand.  Tight to the point of uncomfortable if I wore them for a significant amount of time.

Maybe I just have a stupid big thumb?

Overall, very nice pair of gloves.
review.name: Nice gloves.  Well built.

review.reviewBody:
I've heard a lot of high praise of Hestras and finally decided to spend the money on a nice pair. So far they have stood up to the expectations. I get super cold and these mittens are very good at warming my hands up. Even if I leave them in my cold car I can put them on and they will quickly warm up my hands. The removable liner is super convenient for washing and the outer shell is very durable and the waterproof capabilities on these are insanely good - my hands have been nowhere near getting wet.

I use these when driving (although they are definitely a little bulky for that) and skiing.

If you are not planning on using these gloves in the snow then I wouldn't recommend them just because the wrists are designed to be super large to keep out snow so it would look super bulky if you were wearing these gloves without a bigger jacket.

They also come with wrist attachments which are super convenient so that you can take them off while on the ski lift and not worry about them falling to the ground.

For sizing I measured my hands and ordered to the recommended size and they were true to fit (size 8).
review.name: I love these gloves

review.reviewBody: Haven't worn them skiing yet but the Mitts are top notch quality.  You get what you pay for!  I have extremely sensitive hands due to a hand accident, lost the tip of my finger in snow blower accident and these seem to keep hand warm in extreme conditions.  Not sure what they are like in rain or snow and cold but so far so good.
review.name: Great Mitt

name: Army Leather Heli Mitten - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Powder Maven Fleece Full-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Overall this seems like a great jacket. It’s fairly lightweight but very soft and comfy. The fit is kinda short and boxy, but I actually liked the look upon trying it on. It felt true to size (medium). I ordered it in the pink smoky quartz and it did seem a little more on the brown side in real life, which was kinda disappointing. The main problem was the sleeve length—or lack thereof. They were fine if I was standing still with my arms at my sides, but the moment I moved, they hiked way up. I’m 5’10” and have long arms, so this is something I’m used to struggling with when trying on clothes, but I have several other Mountain Hardwear jackets and have never had an issue with the sleeve length. I really wanted to love the jacket, and it did seem good quality, hence the 4 stars. But ultimately I ended up returning it because the sleeves were a dealbreaker.
review.name: Almost perfect

name: Powder Maven Fleece Full-Zip Jacket - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Olympus Mid GTX 2 Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have lonepeak trail runners in size 9, these feel a full size smaller. But I took them on a 4 1/2 mile hike so I am stuck. I was thinking they might feel better after the hike but they did not. So while I like the boot, I bought the wrong size.
review.name: Sizing off but boot seems good

review.itemreviewed: Olympus Mid GTX 2 Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Left shoe began to squeak a few weeks into wear. Have cleaned and inspected. Both shoes now squeaking after just over one month use. Very disappointing.
review.name: Squeak, squeak

review.itemreviewed: Olympus Mid GTX 2 Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought this boot without checking the reviews, and after about 7 miles of wear I started to get some pain on the outside of my right ankle. It almost seemed like the stitching was too tight on the interior seam there. So I changed socks (right foot to left foot) and kept going. The next day I did about 8 miles with a pair of really thick socks and the laces a little loose to start. I also got the boots pretty damp/wet to start. I had to stop a couple times and re adjust the boot and sock. After that they feel fully broken in, and by far the most comfortable boot I have ever hiked in. I have been hiking as a guide for 30 plus years. I remember when all good boots came with a long, and often very uncomfortable break in period. I am not saying that this isn't a design flaw in the boot, it probably is, but if they hold up for another 80 plus miles I will gladly buy another pair, and go through the break in process if necessary. Its thats comfy. The last heavy pack trip I did my feet have never been so pain free. I got done and couldn't believe it. No aches, no hot spots, no soreness, nothing. Really impressive. So, maybe you will have an ankle issue? Maybe it will go away pretty quickly if you take care of it? Maybe you will buy different boots. The last thing I will say is this. I buy, and completely wear out a lot of boots every year. I have never owned a pair that lasted for more than 90 miles of wet heavy packing, that didn't have some break in issues.
review.name: 80 miles in and a really awesome boot, BUT

review.itemreviewed: Olympus Mid GTX 2 Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Man, I don't know what people are talking about the boot being uncomfortable. I'm on a k9 unit and I wanted a hiking boot for tracking in the woods and I'm buying in to the whole anatomical boot shape thing. It's sooooo much more comfortable on my foot than a salomon or a lowa. I had the keen nxis evo and those are perfect as well but I wear body armor and a pack for the dogs rehab and the cushion on the olympus helps keeping my feet in service. Thank you Altra for making the all black version. I never had the 4 or the 5 but the health features this has are what I'm looking for and the comfort is there.
review.name: Good for k9

review.itemreviewed: Olympus Mid GTX 2 Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Just avoid the entire line. While the shoe fits well when stationary, movement creates issues. The shoe is uncomfortable around the ankle and squeaks louder than cicadas at the height of summer. There is a disconnect between the construction and design folks, and it apparently there is more focus on expanding the line instead of fixing the problems. I might try one last iteration, but I miss the threes and maybe even the fours.
review.name: Same complaints; different person

review.itemreviewed: Olympus Mid GTX 2 Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Excellent choice for law enforcement duty boot. Feet and legs are no longer tired at the end of shift and feet stay dry no matter the temperature or conditions. Well done Altra.
review.name: Excellent duty boot

review.itemreviewed: Olympus Mid GTX 2 Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Same exact issues as the Olympus 5s. The crease between the upper and the front panel of the shoe digs into the ankle and is painful when stepping. People have been talking about the pinching at the ankle for over a year on the 5s. How have they not fixed this on the 6s!!??
review.name: Same Problems as Olympus 5 - Does Altra Even Listen?

review.itemreviewed: Olympus Mid GTX 2 Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Too much support on outside of sole, too little on inside - makes it pronate badly - wished they would return to the quality of the Olympus 3's and 4's - designers can't possibly have tried these on
review.name: As uncomfortable as the Olympus 5 Hiker

review.itemreviewed: Olympus Mid GTX 2 Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I was super excited to get the new Olympis 6 Trail as I have feet issues that cause a lot of pain when backpacking, which zero drop shoes remedy. I also was hoping that the peeling sole issues from the previous model was fixed as I hike in the SW mtns. So, after a few hikes trying to break in the leather on these I can report that the way the upper boot creases at the forefoot bend (just above big joint) is painful!!! I am not sure if it is the leather or the new Goretex liner (which feels dangerously thin BTW) but it is not good! Perhaps this will break in further, but as I leave for a trip to the Southern San Juans, I am concerned... Did the folks at Altra actual walk around in these for more than a minute??? As is, I doubt that anyone would find these to be comfortable. This is a shame as the boot has a unique stiffness in the midsole for the amount of cushion which in theory makes it uniquely suitable for backpacking (You can still feel a bunch of pointy rocks undergoot BTW). Also, come on Altra could you give us a third color? These colors aren't as good as the previous model.
review.name: Do Shoe Designers Actually Wear their Products? Bad Crease!

review.itemreviewed: Olympus Mid GTX 2 Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these for duty boots and couldn't be happier. They are super light, very supportive and comfortable. I'm going to order another pair. My only gripe is that they are not a true black, more of a dark grey. I wish Altra made an actual black version.
review.name: Great boots!

name: Olympus Mid GTX 2 Hiking Boot - Men's
