review.reviewBody: This jacket is really stylish and warm! Really love the dark yellow plaid color. I am a five foot nine, one hundred and forty pound- I ordered a medium. I could have sized down, since it's a bit boxy, but I don't mind that it's a bit big, so I can wear a hoodie underneath.
review.name: Nice Jacket

review.reviewBody: Love this! It has a nice style and it's really warm. I ordered a medium as a female (5;9 and 140 lbs)- could have sized down since it's a little boxy, but will probably layer it over a hoodie.
review.name: nice flannel

review.reviewBody: I bought one of these shirts years ago and really loved it, but it was starting to get worn out and buttons were falling off so I ordered this to replace it. It's definitely not the same shirt. It has less insulation, is a tighter fit in the shoulders, and is made with an exterior fabric that wrinkles really easily. I would return it, but I washed it before wearing it. It's still a decent mid-weight shirt, just not as good as my previous one.
review.name: Changed since the last I

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] fits perfect. replaces one 10 yrs old.
review.name: Cozy and fitting

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The is one of my all-time favorite pieces of clothing! It is so versatile and warm, but not too bulky. I use it year round: around the house or as a mid-layer in winter, and camping evenings in the summer. I love the smooth inside sleeves for slipping over a layer without bunching up, and the snaps! My only complaint is there is not a women's version currently offered.
review.name: I would buy this flannel fleece again and again.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice and warm for the winter month. It reduces the need to layer multiple clothes during the cold days
review.name: Would buy again

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My go-to for those chilly days to use as the perfect warming layer that's also really lightweight. My only critique is that I wish it had an INSIDE chest pocket.
review.name: Chilly Day Go-To

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My husband has three of these in different patterns and colors. They fit him perfectly, wash well and are great for layering.
review.name: Keeping my husband warm!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Awesome shirt to wear out in the evening, when camping, anywhere when it's cooler and no need for a jacket.
review.name: I would buy again.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very confortable
review.name: I would buy this again

review.reviewBody: I have had several pairs. I really appreciate the lightweight material. I find them very versatile   Can use any where
review.name: Great pants!

review.reviewBody:
I purchased these pants a month ago for a 8 day hiking trip in Yellowstone and the Grand Tetons.
Super comfortable, many pockets, great fit.
Highly recommend them.
review.name: Extremely Comfortable

review.reviewBody:
Light, airy, great quality...I like them so much that I am wearing them too often lol

It's a perfect pant because it's sporty and great for hiking. But they're slim fit and super tailored so it has a nice trim cut to it. Absolutely recommend to anyone looking for a great hiking pant but even more so, a great alternative and competitor to pretty much any Lululemon ABC pant out there.
review.name: My new favorite pants

hasVariant.description: Buy the Red Wing Heritage Silversmith Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Ended up going on a trip to NYC after getting the books and walked 10+ miles comfortably (one blister but that's the price of breaking them in). I did have to go with the wide option which I've never had to do before. So glad I finally purchased these!
review.name: I've wanted these boots for so long!
comment: Thank you for your review! We are glad to hear that your boots are working well for you, minus the rough break in period. We hope to continue to serve you in the future!

review.reviewBody: I first bought these boots in November 2023, and carefully broke them in (walked a total of 20 miles!) before a trip to Spain and Portugal. They did take time to break in, but they were perfect on the trip when I was in my feet all day. The tongue did have a tendency to fold over initially, but that changed as the boot softened and broke in. I also noticed damage from the inside of the eyelets on the tongue, like another reviewer, and red wing replaced the boots in January. This time I took matters into my own hands and made sure the eyelets were pressed in fully (just needed a hammer and a piece of wood with a hole drilled in it). I’ve had these ones since January and just conditioned them with leather cream. They didn’t darken at all. They look awesome and get lots of compliments. The mocha is so light that it shows wear and tear—but in a really cool way. I have the Clara’s in black and those are older but look newer—these mocha ones are just a more sensitive leather. But I like that effect!
review.name: Mocha Silversmith—beautiful color, great boot
comment: We are happy to hear that you are enjoying the Silversmiths in the new Mocha color and also own the Clara style! Thank you for the review and for supporting our brand!

review.reviewBody: Many reviewers said the copper/red doesn’t come through in pictures. It is hard to tell, but out of the box these are a beautiful dark orange or even purple color. The copper started to change and streak as soon as I put my feet in them. I was on the fence about keeping these after I bought them because they were kind of an impulse buy, but now after seeing them I cannot send them back. It’s my second pair of Silversmiths so I already know they will fit beautifully once they’re broken in. Keep making gorgeous boots Red Wing!
review.name: Color is deceiving in pictures
comment: Thank you for your positive feedback! We are so happy to hear you love them! Enjoy!

review.reviewBody: These boots are beautiful and well made. I went with my instincts and experience wearing all leather boots and ordered my usual size 8. Many people suggested sizing up half size, but I just hate doing that and trusted that the boot would break in. They were extremely tight and uncomfortable for 2 weeks. I conditioned the leather, wore thick socks and wore them thru the pain. They have now perfectly molded to my foot with no tightness or rubbing. The mocha color is beautiful too. They are simple boots with no over thought "tech" which is my preference. My only critique is that the cork insole could have been a teeny bit wider. I occasionally feel the edges. Otherwise perfection
review.name: Lovely minimalist classic

review.reviewBody: Absolutely gorgeous! First time buying Red Wings, these are honestly so much more comfortable than I expected for new shoes. They definitely do run slightly narrow so going up half a size is a good idea.
review.name: Really comfy!

review.reviewBody: I don’t know why people would put a bad review on these boots other than that they’re impossible to please! These boots are amazing and I love how rustic they look. They don’t take long to break in either.
review.name: Great boot!
comment: Thanks for this great review! We are excited to serve you again!

review.reviewBody: I get compliments on these boots constantly! I was looking for a replacement/upgrade for my old Laredo lace-up riding boots, and these had the speed hooks and height I needed. They're like combat boots meets riding boots -- stylish and durable and extremely high quality. I just added my fringe kilties, and they're perfection!
review.name: practical and beautiful
comment: Thank you for your review! We are glad to hear that your boots are working well for you. We hope to continue to serve you in the future!

review.reviewBody: I bought these boots last spring and when they came I was so disappointed! I wear a 10 regular in shoes/boots. After reading reviews, people said to size up a half size since they run very narrow. However, they don't come in a 10.5 and I knew 11 would be too long. I ordered the 10, and I could barely get my foot in, they are soooo narrow! I wanted them to fit so bad, they are a beautiful boot! Well, luckily we have a cobbler not too far from us, I took them in, had them stretched, and less than 2 days later I had boots that fit! It took another 2 weeks or so of break in and ever since they get better and better. With jeans, and even in the summer with dresses. You get what you pay for and these boots are no exception! Love Love Love!!
review.name: Love These Boots!
comment: Thank you for your review! We are glad to hear that your boots are working well for you. We hope to continue to serve you in the future!

review.reviewBody: 1 year and counting! These are a wardrobe staple in winter for me. It took a while to break them in but now I wear them most days all day to work and on long walks with my GSD. I highly recommend trying on in the store for the experience because the clerks are extremely helpful and knowledgeable about the brand and how their boots should fit. I chose to size-up because I have a wide foot and I typically do that for boots. 7 to an 8. There is no heel slippage even after break-in which I was originally nervous about with sizing up. Very good quality so I am glad I chose Red Wing for my everything boots! Also... with wide feet, I too, have felt my toes hang slightly over the edge of the inner sole.... but I know that the inner sole is made of cork and intended to change with wear... to mold to my foot. The initial gap I felt is filling out over time as the boot breaks in *everywhere* I don’t think that is a manufacturing issue like someone else had said.
review.name: Great Quality & Wardrobe Staple

review.reviewBody: Bought my regular size 7, fits like a glue. Comfortable out of box, and no break in needed. The best boots I have owned.
review.name: I am in love

name: Silversmith Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Phenomenal traction for SoCal trails in the Conejo Valley. Put this 27.5x2.6 Assegai on my turbo levo rear with an 29x2.5 MaxxGrip up front and immediately notched downhill PRs on my regular trails vs the stock Butcher/Eliminator combo. Insane grip but I won’t be running this as a rear on my acoustic bikes because there is way too much rolling resistance. 5 stars love this tire.
review.name: This tire shreds

review.reviewBody: I got the khaki shorts and they’re comfortable but the color is so different than the picture—like a lot lighter! Kinda disappointed since backcountry won’t offer a free exchange…
review.name: Comfy but color is way off!

review.reviewBody: Fits well. I like the elastic band in the back. Adds to comfort.
review.name: Cute shorts

review.reviewBody: These shorts are great for summer! They have an elastic waistband in the back which makes them pretty comfortable as well. I do recommend sizing down- I’m usually a 6 to 8 in women’s pants so I got a medium, but because of the way the shorts flare out, they were kind of comical looking/ too long and I returned. Size small fits perfect!
review.name: Cute and comfy

review.reviewBody:
I bought these in the Kalamata and they're really flattering on, I would definitely recommend throwing them in the dryer after you get them because the corduroy was a little crushed when I pulled them out of the box so putting them in the dryer helped with that. They're high waisted 
 so looks really good with a crop top and with sneakers.
review.name: Cute and stylish

description: Buy the Backcountry Cardiac GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Cardiac GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Backcountry Cardiac GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Cardiac GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: I ordered a large based on the size chart but the legs are huge, especially the flare at the bottom. The material is so loud when I walk and rubs against each other. The butt area has too much space and looks embarrassing. I loved the space in the thighs because my legs are huge compared to my upper body due to weightlifting. I ordered a medium in hopes that all my problems with the large would be resolved. Nope. The waist/lower breast area is too tight and when I sit it's hard to breath so that's not going to work for me either. Ultimately, I've had to return both and continue my search for a bib.
review.name: Ordered two sizes but had to return

review.itemreviewed: Cardiac GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody:
It's great quality and price 
But how many in the world could fit in size M and above
Even their model is 5"10 wearing a small and this is the smallest size ?
Come on
review.name: Please fix the fitting

review.itemreviewed: Cardiac GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love these.  Very comfortable and tons of pockets. I could keep everything I need for a long day on the slopes.
review.name: So comfortable and tons of storage

review.itemreviewed: Cardiac GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: This jacket is exactly what I was looking for. It’s waterproof, breathable, and allows for lots of mobility. It runs big but the oversized style is exactly what I wanted for comfort and mobility!
review.name: Perfect snowboarding jacket!

review.itemreviewed: Cardiac GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: +1 to the reviewer who said these are the best backcountry bibs out there. I'm obsessed with the pockets, and the pockets in pockets.  You see that little mesh pocket at the waist? That is the perfect pocket for fruit snacks to eat one by one on the uphill. The legs have mesh pockets in the pockets. Put my phone there for easy access to take photos from the top. 50 mph winds? no problem, these pants are truly windproof. They're big, baggy, and light as a feather, so if you're looking for pants to make your butt look cute, check out a different pair. If you're looking to save weight with bibs that are functional AF, look no further. Oh, and the purple color is much nicer IRL. I love them so much that I tried to get the jacket so I could rock a full purple suit but y'all are sold out.
review.name: my friends are jealous of these bibs

review.itemreviewed: Cardiac GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love love love these bibs. They’re durable, block out wind and moisture, but can also be easily vented. They have plenty of pockets and the color is fantastic! Agree they run large - I normally wear a small and the extra small is still fairly baggy on me. Just a couple small things: I wish they had a stronger snap for the front zipper because when popping into low turns or landing a jump, it tends to pop open and then the zipper comes undone as well. The legs are a little short on me as to be expected, so would appreciate clips at the end to hold them over ski boots like many brands have. Otherwise fantastic!
review.name: Almost perfect!

review.itemreviewed: Cardiac GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are more traffic cone orange than they looked in the photos, but I still love them. Per other reviewers, I sized down and am so glad I did. I am 5’4”, a size 2-4 in pants, athletic  build with narrow shoulders, and the XS is perfect. I would say there is still room in the ribs/hips area if I were to be bigger.
review.name: Run big, but love them

review.itemreviewed: Cardiac GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I'm 50. I'm a CrossFitter w/ athletic upper-legs, and as an elder babe "adjusting to a new season of life," I'm a lot heavier than I've ever been. And, I love having boobs and a booty! I've blown-out my lead-leg knee 2x, so also wear a 20y/o CTI Lite knee-brace. Sure, I'd love to replace it with something leaner, but that time isn't here just yet.

I ride to shred, not to go-out looking like Barbie in bibs. I also started to ride in the 1990s, so prefer the baggier fit. These are the ONLY bibs I've found with BOTH a rear-exit for potty breaks in the woods, room for my knee brace, room for my booty/thighs, room for my oversized belleh, AND room for layers. The only other bibs I was seriously considering, were Flylow's Baker bibs. For dudes. Cuz they're also a cute pink; but had no rear-exit.

Sure, someday I'd love to be able to fit into Barbie-shaped bibs with the pin-tucked knees & everything; but I no longer have time for lengthy hospital stays or years to rebuild an atrophied leg from an ACL tear. And, I wanna squat +200lbs in the next coupla years. TL;DR, these bibs are CUTE, and feel like they're gonna let me shred all day in comfort. THANK YOU for making these bibs suited for my older, transitioning, burly body. <3

Stoked as hell to take these out, tomorrow. I've been trying on bibs for TWO YEARS, and these are the first ones I feel confidently awesome about. Yes, the material feels a touch flimsy (which I'm a little worried about); but they also weigh less than half of what my bulky Carhartts did. If these don't hold up, I'll return to update my review.
review.name: Perimenopausal shredbetty LOVE!!

review.itemreviewed: Cardiac GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: I LOVE the color, but the pants were way too baggy. I ordered an XS, so I had to return. Too bad, I hope the next reiteration will be more slim fit.
review.name: Love the colors

review.itemreviewed: Cardiac GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Pleasantly surprised by these bibs! Has everything you’d expect in a high end goretex pant- good pockets, zippers, and quality build ect. 
What I ended up loving about these that was unexpected is that they work as both bibs and pants for me! I’m taller than average so can have a hard time with bibs being long enough. When I tried these on I found the way they are cut I can wear them a low sitting pant or a traditional bib, which is awesome. Super comfortable and have already got a lot of compliments from strangers on the color(I got the red&pink). Big fan!
review.name: I’m a fan

name: Cardiac GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Alpine Onset Merino 150 Crew Top - Men's
review.reviewBody: I just got back from a cross country ski trip, and could t stop thinking about how much I love my shirt. I have the old version of this and it is the most useful piece of clothing I own (hopefully they haven’t changed much between this and the old one). I use it as a base layer from September to May and keep it as a warm layer otherwise. It is the first warm piece of gear that goes into my bag. It never smells, despite wearing it for days on end while backpacking. It dries so quickly and is super comfortable. After owning it for roughly 5+ years,  it still looks great. I have other merino pieces that have bitten the dust and started to get threads but this one has kept its quality. Definitely will purchase again, just don’t need to yet haha.
review.name: Most useful layer in my closet

name: Alpine Onset Merino 150 Crew Top - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Signature Sleeve Logo Long-Sleeve T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: About a good 85% of my clothing is Carhartt work clothing and I like all of it...jackets, vests, work jeans, shirts.  The long sleeve tees are great.  The price is high, but the quality is good.
review.name: Good clothing

review.itemreviewed: Signature Sleeve Logo Long-Sleeve T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Well made they do run big so if you wear a large get a medium
review.name: Shirts

review.itemreviewed: Signature Sleeve Logo Long-Sleeve T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought this for my husband as a Christmas gift.  He loved it. Great quality and features.
review.name: Would buy this product again

review.itemreviewed: Signature Sleeve Logo Long-Sleeve T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Was a birthday gift for my husband.  He is a big guy (3x-4x) and it fits him great, not too slim like long sleeve Tshirts tend to be sometimes.  He loves it!
review.name: Great fit even on a bigger guy

review.itemreviewed: Signature Sleeve Logo Long-Sleeve T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Looked nice,but is a gift for someone else which hasn't been opened yet
review.name: Gift

review.itemreviewed: Signature Sleeve Logo Long-Sleeve T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great work shirt for my husband! Keeps him warm and is durable, he also looks great it it!
review.name: Good winter work shirt!

review.itemreviewed: Signature Sleeve Logo Long-Sleeve T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Nice quality shirt. Well-made and washes well. My only complaint is that it definitely runs large. I typically wear a medium, but this shirt in a medium was huge. And I'm not talking about the loose fit. I'm talking about the overall sizing. Lesson learned. If I buy more I'll just go with a small and will be very happy
review.name: Runs large

review.itemreviewed: Signature Sleeve Logo Long-Sleeve T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Carhartt fitment is awful. I'm 5'8 170 pounds. I typically wear large t's and sweatshirts. Knowing how loose fit is, I bought several of these shirts in a medium and they fit like a nightgown. Exchanged them for a small and they're too tight. Everything from carhartt fits me that way so I hardly ever buy the brand anymore. Quality is great but fitment is poor. Not sure why anyone that works in a trade would want to wear long, baggy clothes. I work in excavation and oversized clothes dont do well.
review.name: good quality, fits poorly

review.itemreviewed: Signature Sleeve Logo Long-Sleeve T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: My husband absolutely loves these shirts.  He especially likes the banded sleeves.  They are thicker so they are much warmer.  That way he only has to wear a vest with them instead of a bulky coat.
review.name: Love These Shirts

review.itemreviewed: Signature Sleeve Logo Long-Sleeve T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Nothing wrong with the shirt but I returned it due to the loose fit being like dress.
review.name: Loose fit is basically a size bigger than normal

name: Signature Sleeve Logo Long-Sleeve T-Shirt - Men's

review.reviewBody: I wear a size 11.5  to 12 shoe so I bough the L/XL sock as I always do.  I could not get them over my heel and had to give them to a friend because I tore them slightly.  Otherwise they appeared to be a good quality product.  As I am finding with all Castelli stuff, expect to go waay up on sizing.
review.name: L/XL socks always fit me, until now.

review.reviewBody:
Foot size: EU 44 / US 10.5

Very thin and definitely only for the hottest days or longest rides. They are about half the thickness as the socks I train with. They do have arch support, but are definitely not as supportive as more orthopedic/barostatic socks.
review.name: Foot gauze

review.reviewBody: Nice sock but they run VERY small.  I am a size 12 shoe and got XXL and could not even get them over my heel.  I gave them to my wife who is a women's size 7 shoe and they fit her perfectly, so an XXL sock is a women's size 7.
review.name: EXTREMELY SMALL

review.reviewBody: These are great, but I wear a size 10 shoe and I ordered a L/XL.  After washing these were way to small and I ripped them putting them on.  Order a size up.
review.name: they run small

review.reviewBody: ...I put them on. Not sure if I got a bunk pair but they ripped without pulling super hard. Extremely small for XXL size, maybe they were mislabeled. Excellent service from Backcountry in refunding me.
review.name: Ripped the first time...

name: Superleggera 12 Sock

description: Buy the Burley Nomad Bike Trailer Cargo Rack online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Nomad Bike Trailer Cargo Rack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Burley Nomad Bike Trailer Cargo Rack online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Tried for 2 hours to attach this thing and couldn't get it. It just doesn't line up with the trailer.
review.name: Tried for 2 hours to

review.reviewBody: The trailer end rack are just the ticket for the transcontinental tour that I’ll be making in March 2023. I’ve used across Florida and am actively using it now for preparation for my 2023 trip.
review.name: The trailer end rack are

review.reviewBody: The rack does not fit the top attachment points. It's either too wide or too narrow depending on how much time one spends trying to make it fit. For the price, this is unacceptable. I will try the hardware store and get nylon spacers and longer bolts. If that doesn't work I will have to return the rack. I expected top quality from Burley. Very disappointed.
review.name: Rack does not fit the nomad

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Was surprisingly easy to install as long as you don't tighten down all the bolts until you have all 4 theaded. Wasn't happy with the bottom 2 attached so close to the canvas bottom and the bolts rough ends, definitely would cause holes so I purchased 3/8" rubber screw protectors, black or yellow, and cut off just enough to cover the bolt end and nut. Perfect! The push buttons for lifting and folding of the racks positions is not done easily with fingers, almost impossible! I had an old rubber tipped stylus pen that was just thick enough to push in the spring loaded tabs but not enough to push the tabs completely into the tubes! Beware if that happens, you'll say things that'll make a sailor blush! I love the additional space for gear and with the bungee cargo net and an extra backpack rain cover it makes for a great ride, unexpected rain or shine! Highly Recommend
review.name: Nomad Cargo Rack

review.reviewBody: I purchased my Nomad and Cargo rack recently and finally got around to the install this weekend. After spending a frustrating hour trying to get the top of the rack installed with the provided bolts, I finally improvised with a quick trip to the local hardware store. I had to get a couple of bolts that were 1cm longer than the provided bolts as well as a couple of 1/2 cm nylon bushings. With the new bolts/bushings, the rack install took all of 5 minutes. The provided rear bolts fit perfectly. I love the Nomad and the rack, but took away one star for the need to get the proper hardware for the top bolts. I saw earlier comments to the same effect, so thinking this is a known issue.
review.name: Great addition to the Nomad, but needs longer installation bolts

review.reviewBody: I love this Rack too I also ordered a Net to the Rack
review.name: It's a great Rack

review.reviewBody: Rack worked great. We were supposed to stay in all the lodges but that was Covid cancelled. We purchased a rack for our Nomad and were able to to strap our large sleeping pads to the top. It made for a great trip.
review.name: 10 Days in Yellowstone with a tandem

review.reviewBody: Just a nice add on for our trailer. Helps taking things to the beach.
review.name: Just a nice add on

review.reviewBody: Rack supplied with my order doesn't fit newest version of the trailer ordered, so have to interpolate other attachment hardware to get correct fit.
review.name: Doesn't fit well...

review.reviewBody: The rack greatly expands the carrying capability of my Nomad. I place the heavy stuff inside the trailer and easily lash the lighter, longer things up top.
review.name: Expanded versatility

name: Nomad Bike Trailer Cargo Rack

review.reviewBody: Comfortable and cute snow bib!  Didn’t think those two things could go together in a sentence.  I’m in the middle of both the XL and 1X size guidelines for the brand.  The XL was skin tight.  Looked amazing but no way I could ski without the ability or freedom to layer underneath for cold weather so sized up to 1X.  It’s very loose but don’t mind.  First time as a plus size woman to have a snow pant that doesn’t feel tight and restrictive.  So grateful for the extended sizing in this brand!  I’m usually a 16 or a 14w in clothing in pants.  Gorgeous and unique color!  So noticeable on mountain for my kids to find me.
review.name: Plus size women and pear shapes rejoice

review.reviewBody: I have a booty and thighs and the medium fits well
review.name: Absolutely Obsessed!

review.reviewBody: I’ve worn these for two years and love them. Nice to see the newer option includes a zipper for the chest pocket as my chapstick falls out of mine which is Velcro closure. Not a big issue at all. These keep me warm and dry and are super flattering. So glad I got them for Xmas and have worn them skiing since.
review.name: Perfect Bibs

review.reviewBody: this bib is warm, extremely comfortable and actually looks cute on!
review.name: nice bum where you from

review.reviewBody: I love this bib. I get so many compliments on this + the Ronne jacket in the navy color! It’s super comfortable for snowboarding and cute for après too! Definitely want another color.
review.name: Functional + cute

review.reviewBody:
First time bib owner and I’m sold!

So perfectly stretchy in the right places. The material definitely has less stretch than the Isabel, but I have no problem doing a full squat in these. As a larger thighed girlie with a smaller waist, I’ve always had to size up and cinch the waist down as tight as it’ll go. Love that these fit nicely and I can actually move in them!

Snaps that cinch the waist are a bit tight (and I hope they don’t rip out of the pants) but otherwise these are awesome so far
review.name: Awesome ❤️

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This bib is like no other! I’m super long waisted and it fits perfectly!
review.name: Perfect Bib:)

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great quality, amazing features, and perfect colors! These bibs fit perfectly and looked great on the mountain. I plan on buying many more in different colors!
review.name: Great fit and colors!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these pants! The color is so cute and they fit great. Warm enough also
review.name: Cute color

review.reviewBody: Bought these to match my alpine green Lawrence jacket, and so happy I did. By far the cutest ski outfit I’ve owned.  The bibs are super comfy. I am able move around and dig myself out a tree well without feeling constricted. They have deep cozy pockets which are convenient for extra snacks. I am 5ft 3in and the petite length are the only pair of ski pants I’ve owned that don’t drag and they fit perfectly over ski boots. Definitely would recommend.
review.name: Cute and comfy

name: Carson Bib Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: My grandson wanted these for Christmas and told me where to buy them. Thank you so very much!!
review.name: My grandson wanted these for

review.reviewBody: Al principio un poco difícil de usar pero después resulta muy útil para mantener en su posición y asegurar con más precisión.
review.name: Muy util

review.reviewBody: Really like this carabiner to prevent cross loading when I’m belaying and doing top rope solo. Easy functionality to place the device into the anti cross loading location.
review.name: Excellent Cross Load Prevention

review.reviewBody: I do not know why I waited so long to buy this carabiner for my Grigri. My local climbing gym recently mandated that all lead belaying had be done using a brake assisted device and I just got so tired of the "normal" locker bouncing around and getting sideways. Since my device just lives in my gym bag, I bought one of these to keep them together all times and it has made belaying much easier and enjoyable. Highly recommend!
review.name: Stop waiting and just buy it

review.reviewBody: Really great addition to the rack. The perfect carabiner for belaying your friends at the crag
review.name: GridLock Screwgate

review.reviewBody: It's nice to not have to think about the possibility of cross-loading when belaying. Works perfectly with my grigri
review.name: One less thing to worry about

review.reviewBody: I bought a few of these and it has definitely helped make belaying easier. My wife is still new to the sport and it's one less thing she has to focus on while learning.
review.name: Great Belay Option!

review.reviewBody: i love this carabiner when belaying, keeps my grigri from becoming twisted
review.name: perfect carabiner for grigri

review.reviewBody: I love the tab that keeps the belay loop at the bottom to prevent cross loading.
review.name: Great Carabiner and Cool Design

review.reviewBody: A basic design with ease of functionality makes this a fool proof item for its intended purpose. Nothing over complicated, light weight and strong. Why bother with anything else?
review.name: Good deal

name: GridLock Screwgate Carabiner

review.reviewBody: The gloves looked BOMBER, but the fit is so poor that I could not grip a ski pole ice axe or the handlebars on my sled... I have no idea of what went sideways with the development of these but they were un-wearable for me. Grab another pair of Dakine gloves though every other pair I have are great.  Backcountry customer service is FANTASTIC, thank you McKenzie.
review.name: POOR fit !

review.reviewBody:
I bought an XL and a Large knowing I might be right on the line.  The liner is SO thick, neither worked.  It's great that the liner is that thick, and I'm sure they would be VERY warm, but it makes the glove so tight on my hand it was uncomfortable.  If you take the liner out you've kind of defeated the purpose, and the shell by itself is very loose because it's sized, albiet poorly, to hold the huge liner.  

They look durable and warm, but the sizing needs to be adjusted.  These would only work for someone with extremely long fingers, and paper thin wrists.  (Not sure that exists)
review.name: Size is very odd

review.reviewBody: Tried on glove in store.  When I got glove I discovered it has a super thick liner which Dakine probably thinks is added value, and it is very warm, but if you take out the glove becomes super sloppy on the hand.  For normal in resort skiing or snowboarding, I would definitely suggest next size down in combination with thin liners.  The product is not eligible for return so not thrilled about that.
review.name: Too Big

name: Phoenix GORE-TEX Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody: I’m a firefighter and use this on my helmet. I’ve been very happy with how light it is and bright. I have been using it for six months and I have been continually impressed with how well it holds a charge.

I've got two of these now, one for home use and one mounted to the front of my structure fire helmet.  Easy operation with a simple on/off button, two brightness levels that you adjust by simply touching the top right corner of the light.  Holds a charge for an appropriate amount of time.  I have brighter headlamps but this has become my go to due to the size.
review.name: Super lightweight and simple!

review.reviewBody: Great for daily use around the house and yard and for short runs and hikes around the house

Awesome little light. Super light weight and barely noticeable in my pocket. USB charging is a plus. Biggest downside would be overall battery life - would not recommend for ultra running but for a normal early morning/late night run this is perfect.
review.name: Great lightweight running light

review.reviewBody: I got this to run with on dark mornings. It's super light and rechargeable.  Also fairly bright.  Exactly what I needed.
review.name: Nice lightweight headlamp

review.reviewBody: This headlamp has lasted the longest of any lamp that I have purchased for my children. The ability to recharge verses disposable batteries makes it wonderful for kids' use.
review.name: Best Kids Headlamp

review.reviewBody: Great mid-range headlamp for walks and runs, or quick hikes. Comfortable, easy to use, and compact. Plenty bright depending on what you need it for. Nice that I don't have to worry about batteries, just wish it was USB-C for charging!
review.name: Solid headlamp

review.reviewBody: Holds a charge for surprisingly long, ie days and days if I use it for a 1 hour run every day or so. Small and strong!
review.name: Great for quicker night runs

review.reviewBody:
I love not having to use batteries so a rechargeable light headlamp is dope! I love this headlamp!
I do wish the little door that covers the charging port closed a bit more snuggly and easily.
review.name: Light, Bright and Rechargeable

review.reviewBody: I primarily use this as a trail running headlamp in the early evenings and it does not disappoint. I've only had it out for multiple hours at a time on one long excursion where I was running after dark for 2 hours, but it performed well. Keep the battery fully charged and you should have no issues. It is small enough to fit in the pockets on both pair of running shorts I own.
review.name: Surprisingly bright for size and weight

name: Sprint 225 Headlamp
Sprint 225 Headlamp

review.reviewBody: I wish all shoe/boot companies would move towards making the toe box of their shoes and boots like these. Having wide feet, I always buy wide-fitting models, but it seems the tips of the footwear always scrunched into a point.  A previous reviewer noted that the lace keeper may break, so with that in mind, I take it easy lacing them up.  No problems, great fit out of the box.
review.name: Great fit for wide feet.

review.reviewBody:
These boots are amazing and exactly what I've been looking for. For me nothing beats a wide toe box, barefoot-style shoe, and I generally prefer zero-drop as well. And this is the best shoe purchase I've made in a while.

The issue I've had with boots/shoes from other manufacturers in this category is that the sole is a weak spot. I abuse my shoes. They tend to see a lot of rough terrain, conditions, and general wear. From first inspection of these boots, I was pretty confident they'd last me longer than I am used to. The way the sole is designed to attach to the upper means that this boot will withstand a lot of stress on that area and should ultimately mean that my sole isn't falling apart at these points like with some other boots.The boots also feel sturdy and well made. 

Importantly, these boots are super comfortable. I've put these through the motions and honestly love wearing them because they feel great on my feet, and my feet feel great after long days in them.

The water-resistance is also a huge plus. These are definitely on the "warmer" side of the spectrum, and I probably wouldn't wear them in hot weather when I'm going to be sweating a lot, but despite this they are still reasonably breathable and my feet haven't necessarily felt hot when wearing them.

They also look amazing. I got the gray/snow camo pattern and they look better in person than in the photos. 

Overall, this is my first Merrell purchase and it definitely sold me on the company. I know people have been singing praises of these shoes for ages, but once you go barefoot it's hard to go back and I didn't know Merrell had tapped into this category. It's nice knowing that I can get a shoe that works for my feet, is well made, and is also priced extremely competitively.

I highly, highly recommend. I'm definitely purchasing another pair in a different colorway and hope Merrell continues to make shoes in the barefoot category.
review.name: The best shoe purchase I've made in a while
comment: Thank you for sharing your awesome and thorough feedback with us! It's truly appreciated.

review.reviewBody: Great hiking boot, super grip on icy paths. Tested in Brice Canyon with some icy conditions.
review.name: Super grip on ice

review.reviewBody: The Wrapt Mid Waterproof boots are so very comfortable !!  Used on a hike in a hill with uneven terrain and loose rocks. Wide toe box is perfect. Lacing system keeps debris out. Would definitely recommend !
review.name: Hiking

review.reviewBody: A good solid boot and waterproof , fits well, snug ankle support, great traction
review.name: Great boot for all day wear

review.reviewBody: This is what the Chameleon should be. Best one I have had yet! Wide toe box and great support.
review.name: Awesome shoe!
comment: Thank you for the great review!

review.reviewBody: Fits true to size and comfortable.  Very little break-in needed.  The only negative is that the eyelets keep the laces very tight and it's a bit of a struggle taking them off.  Hopefully they will loosen with time.  Love 'em.
review.name: Great Looking Hikers

review.reviewBody: Wow I love these boots! From the minute I slipped my feet into them & stood up I was hooked! They have plenty of space for your toes to splay & spread. They have the perfect amount of sole thickness.. you won’t be experiencing ground feel with these but they are wonderful for that in between boot, not a standard hiker like the Moab but not super thin sole. Great hybrid boots I think they nailed that with the description. They are roomy enough that a half size down does fit me perfectly. The zero drop heel is perfect if you prefer to be barefoot or have minimal shoes on. The mid height is great at keeping dirt & bits out of your boots. Overall fantastic boots. I hike professionally & average about 30/50 miles a week & these have been awesome so far. Will definitely be buying more pairs.
review.name: So comfortable!!

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable. On my farm, durability, dexterity, comfort and practicality are critical. So far, comfort, dexterity and practicality are perfect; time will tell on durability. Very pleased so far.
review.name: Comfortable and practical

review.reviewBody: I replaced the inside and it fits like a glove. I also replaced the laces with no tie, elastic laces, there is you to slip on and super comfortable to walk around in all day.
review.name: Love them

name: Wrapt Mid WP Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Love my new coat! Elegant- very cozy and comfy - not need to be all layered with my Kay - was very very warm on a 30 degree weather!
Have everything that I was looking for! I’m petite so when buying coats or they too long or short - the size usually are weird in comparison to the pictures- but this one is perfect!!!
review.name: Perfect coat!

review.reviewBody: Super warm and beautifully feminine—perfect coat for cold Midwest winters
review.name: Good investment in your warmth

review.reviewBody: Coat was clearly great quality. I ordered several coats to try on from different brands and this was the best one from pure quality standpoint. I compared it to a coat from Soia&kyo which is same parent brand, and this was definitely a step above. The XS fit well - I'm 5'7 125lb. I could have worn a sweater underneath. Seemed like it would be very warm. In the end, as much as I have looked at this coat over the past 2-3 years (and waiting because it is so expensive!), the style just didn't suit me for some reason. It is a beautiful design, but the assymettrical zipper front and the inner neck just didn't work for me stylistically. I wish it worked as I love the hood and close narrow fit.
review.name: Great quality, in the end the style wasn't for me

review.reviewBody: This was a gift for girlfriend and she lovesssss it. Says it keeps her so warm and more importantly not sweaty! She considers herself a big girl but she is in between L and XL. Eventually we went for XL and it's nice to have a little room for air and an extra layer. She says it's the best jacket she's ever had.
review.name: Best Gift

review.reviewBody: Great jacket for temperatures below 30f. Blue color is very elegant. The cut and hood are quite flattering. I had doubts I ll like it as it is a tad heavy compared to my old parka. Once the temperature dropped I can’t part with it. Worth the money.
review.name: Best winter coat

review.reviewBody: Good warm coat, but the pockets were so small my phone barely fit, phone + hands would not happen.  I returned my coat weeks ago and still waiting for refund. Skip it.
review.name: Pockets are tiny.
comment:
Hi Aschlich,
We're sorry that the coat was not to your liking.
Please be aware that due to the busy season and heavy trafficking, we have a been experiencing slight delays on operations.
Please contact us on shop@mackage.ca if you have still been waiting for any updates from us. 
Thank you for feedbacks
Best Regards,

review.reviewBody: I love the look of this jacket, BUT the hood doesn't stay up and the inside collar zipper does hit my chin..but fashion can be painful sometimes.
review.name: Love BUT...

review.reviewBody: The perfect down coat. The belted back gives shape so you don’t look like a blob. Fabric is soft and elegant; I love the matte finish. Still too warm outside to wear it, but seems like it will be up to the job when winter arrives.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: This Coat Is Prefect , And Fitted , I Always Wanted A Mackage and Finally Got One  So Happy Will Order Another One Soon !!
review.name: Small

review.reviewBody: This coat is beautiful I love it and it keeps you warm. I go outside with just a t shirt on am so warm.
review.name: I love this coat

name: Kay Non-Fur Down Jacket - Women's

description: Buy the Nathan Pinnacle 4L Hydration Vest online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Pinnacle 4L Hydration Vest
hasVariant.description: Buy the Nathan Pinnacle 4L Hydration Vest online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Pinnacle 4L Hydration Vest
hasVariant.description: Buy the Nathan Pinnacle 4L Hydration Vest online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excellent fit plenty of storage.  comfy
review.name: Pinnacle 4 liter

review.reviewBody: Great, light-weight vest with two bottles and multiple pockets in front.  There is an optional back bladder, or use the separated compartments for additional storage.  High quality!
review.name: Functional/front bottles

review.reviewBody: The pack is great! The bottles have the hardest lids to put on. Like it’s a struggle for me to put the lids on without spilling water/mix everywhere. I thought it was just me, but even race volunteers ask for me to put the lid on the bottles because they can’t get them on. Once lids on are, bottles are good.
review.name: Bad bottles

review.reviewBody: It took almost 3 weeks from purchase to arrive.  In which I missed the widow for using it for my race.  I ran 15 miles in it for a long run last weekend, I did feel bouncy/unsecure especially after drinking the water in the bladders.  I have a similar pack from another brand, I was hoping this would be an upgrade but unfortunately not.
review.name: Good enough hydro vest

review.reviewBody: Yes- you can put a 2L pouch in the back (sold separately).  So, with 2L in the back and 2 x 600ml in the front, this light little slip of fabric can pretty comfortably hold 3.2L plus nutrition, your phone, TP and other essential stuff.  The bite vales are designed really well- you get a really high fluid flow through them and they seal perfectly.  The front bottles have a thin plastic firm strip embedded in one side- to make the otherwise flexible bottles easier to slip into the pockets.  However- after 20mi, that firm side definitely did start to dig into my lower ribs.  So I turned the bottles around.  There’s zippered pocket on the inside of the front water bottles- big enough for a phone- but having a hard phone in that location would get uncomfortable.  Instead - I shoved my phone in either of the lower rear back pockets that are easy to reach.   No matter how perfect and sorted out each of these products is- none are ever perfect.  Anyway- this will make a great fast pack for my upcoming ultras.  Nathan does a great job with this one.
review.name: Super light and soft and carries a ton

review.reviewBody: I have the Nathan pinnacle in the light blue 12L version. I got the exact same size so I clipped the tags off and went to take this for a run. Wow it’s so much tighter which really confuses me. They are both pinnacle packs and the size chart looks the same to me. This one I have at its loosest adjustment while the other one I can pull it halfway with a full bladder. Disappointed in this one. It honestly feels like it’s a size down and labeled incorrectly.
review.name: Really tight…weird

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have had this vest now for a couple years and have taken it everywhere. OCR, many ultras, snow, extreme heat you name it. At this point its still holding up even after several cycles the the washer. My only critique would be the magnetic attachment for the hose to the vets. I lost it with in the first couple weeks would like to see that be permanently attached.  
Favorite Features -
Water resistant zip pockets 
Easy access side pockets
Allows you to carry more than enough hydration than you'll need
review.name: Solid Vest

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I absolutely love this hydration pack. I have only used a few different brands from when I was in the military that would always bounce, the straps would come loose, the packs would be ill fitting etc. I am training for a 50 miler next month and decided to pull the trigger. I chose the pinnacle 4L because it had some good reviews and obviously I trust the brand. That being said it outperformed my expectations. Smooth, fitting, comfortable, no bounce, straps stay tight as you put them. Absolutely recommend!
review.name: Great purchase, highly recommend.

review.reviewBody: Fits really well 100k with it tommorow.
review.name: Luv it

review.reviewBody: Vest works well.  I am in between S and M. I ordered a small. My only recommendation would be to increase the strap length to provide more flexibility with fitting.  The bottom strap is extended all the way out and works but it would be nice to have more length.  Thank you.
review.name: Hydration Vest

name: Pinnacle 4L Hydration Vest

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are my favorite shoes I own! The do everything they say and are super comfortable.
review.name: Great shoes!
comment: Thank you for the awesome feedback!

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love it. It is very comfortable and stylish. In my second week wearing it to work, I already received tons of compliments.
review.name: Excellent for casual work

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I am loving my boots! They didn’t need break in time as they were comfortable right away for my first hike. They are 100% waterproof and stylist at the same time. I am very impressed and want another colour too.
review.name: Exceptionally warm and comfortable Boots

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love these! Sturdy ankle, actually waterproof, and extremely comfortable. Love the colour too
review.name: Please keep making these!

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Easy break in, super comfortable! Hiked through the mountains for two days with no issues.
review.name: Perfect for my first pair of boots.

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Purchase for hiking and trip to Japan in winter. Super comfortable shoe and great to walk. No need to break them in.
review.name: Great hiking shoe

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Absolutely love them! I ordered a half size bigger than my usual and there has been zero blisters or break in period. So much cushioning and my ankles feel so stable. Also very breathable despite the gortex. The peach colour was also a big draw!
review.name: Well done, Merrell!

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I purchased these as a replacement to my old Moab’s & I’m happy I did! They’re cute/trendy and very comfortable. I brought these as my only shoes on a trip to Norway & Scotland and my feet only hurt a little on day (to be expected) but after that I was pain free & had 0 issues. Highly recommend!
review.name: Super Comfy & Waterproof!
comment: We appreciate your valuable feedback. Thank you for sharing your thoughts with us!

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Recently bought these boots, and hiked 10 miles this past weekend. These boots were comfortable and very light weight. These trails were uneven, muddy and rocky. I crossed a few creeks with no issues. I am a clumsy hiker and not once did I feel my ankle went unsupported. I definitely would recommend these boots! I can’t wait to try them on a 14er this summer.
review.name: An all-around great boot
comment: Appreciate you sharing your thoughts with us!

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
In love with these shoes! Super comfortable and lightweight if you’re packing them to travel! With the right sock, they keep my feet warm and dry. 
Bonus: they look cute and go with everything! It’s so hard to find shoes as practical as these in a single colour.
review.name: Practical and Stylish!

name: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: I bought these looking for a comfortable indoor shoe that I could use at work.  The jury is definitely still out, you can see from the pictures that the back of the shoe is low - but it is a lot lower than it looks.  I think it will take a bit to get used to something hitting an odd spot on my heel.  I would also agree with others that have said the shoe runs a bit small.  I worry that if I order up, my heel will slide out when I walk.
review.name: Not sure about the shoe...
comment: We value your feedback and if we can help please give us a call at 800-288-3124 or live chat at Merrell.com. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: I love my Encore Breeze 5. They fit perfectly and are very comfortable.
review.name: Encore Breeze 5

review.reviewBody: Bought a pair a few years ago for use indoors, and wanted a second for indoor use. Comfortable and stylish.
review.name: Repeat customer

review.reviewBody: The shoes last. They don’t stretch out and get sloppy looking after months of wear.  The inner soles can be removed and laundered. Various colors match one’s daily fashion. Love , love these shoes!!
review.name: Love these shoes!

review.reviewBody: Have worn Encore Breeze for years and loved them, so comfortable and help my arch..I do not like the knit collar. When I slip into the shoe it folds over and the seam at the back is irritating on my heels. Please bring the quality of the encore breeze merrells back!!
review.name: Horrible fit

review.reviewBody: These are perfect shoes for travel.  They easily slip off when going thru security but secure enough to wear on escalators,  running between gates or walking on cobblestone streets. They are comfortable and look good.
review.name: Perfect for travel or casual walks

review.reviewBody: Wonderfully comfortable, lightweight, and fast and easy to slip on and off!
review.name: So light and comfortable!
comment: Thank you for the great feedback, Page!

review.reviewBody: I have worn shoes from Merrell for 20 years; different styles of course. Comfort is most important to me and I have relied on Merrells providing that comfort for me. The only thing I have had to change is my shoe size has changed.
review.name: Comfort and Quality Provided by Merrell Shoes
comment: Your positive feedback made our day!

review.reviewBody: I've had at least a half dozen pair of Merrell's Encore Breeze, size 7, but my most recent pair barely fits wearing even a thin sock! Either they're making everything a little smaller, or there's a size variation depending on the country/factory in which they're manufactured. Last time I tried a 7.5, but it was a little too big.
review.name: Be very careful with sizing!

review.reviewBody: Super lightweight, fits well without socks, can wear a lightweight sock without overstretching shoe. Easy on & off without excessive heel lift that tires out the calf muscles.
review.name: Sleek & comfy support

name: Encore Breeze 5 Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: Purchased last year, and love this parka! I was lucky enough to have gotten it on sale, much less than the new price, yikes... But I would still say it's worth it. I'm in Northern Canada, and can confirm it is very warm and comfy! Lots of pockets! I like the relaxed shape and extra roominess. However, my only little critique would be for them to add in a waist cinch, so you can tighten it up in the middle to keep more draft down. I love the double zipper, very good feature (and hard to find now) for a long jacket! I would say it fits a bit bigger than actual size, since I also have a Helium down jacket in the same size that fits smaller (almost a whole size) than this one. For reference i am 5'6' (was)190 lbs, bought XL. I have since lost weight, am now 162lbs and can confirm a large would be sufficient. I hope this helps someone:)
review.name: Warm+comfy and fits a bit larger than actual size.

review.reviewBody: I'm almost 6ft tall, and athletic/muscular, which can make it challenging to find ladies sizing in outdoor clothing that fits a woman's shape. This fits the bill! A miracle - it actually fits my hips/bootie, and goes all the way to upper hips, as an alpine parka should! Half star off, which is esthetic only - in the yellow, the fabric is rather see-thru, and the inside stuffing is multicolored, and looks a little odd. Very lightweight with a stuff sack. Taking this one mountaineering!
review.name: Excellent sizing for athletic/tall

review.reviewBody: Warm and lightweight. Big hood, deep pockets and soft around the chin when zipped up!
review.name: Awesome gear!

review.reviewBody: If you are climbing in under 30F weather regularly this is the jacket for you. It is insanely warm. To warm for anything by above freezing. 5’3 130 lbs and size small fit great.
review.name: Warm and Comfortable Belay Jacket

review.reviewBody: This is one of the warmest and coziest jackets ever. The hood fits over a helmet and cinches down to keep the snow and wind out.
review.name: Love this jacket!

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this jacket!! It is so incredibly warm and comfortable, while still being lightweight enough to not feel like you can't move at all. Easily handling -10F temps, the hood also is nice and big with a wonderfully soft lining. The length is perfect as it covers your hips without making you feel trapped at any point - super easy to move around in without letting any cold air escape up the sides. My only comment is that I wish the front pockets (which are huge by the way!!!) were positioned just a little bit higher - I sometimes find myself having to reach down just a bit to fish out things that may have worked their way to the bottom. Regardless, I still absolutely love it and would highly recommend!!
review.name: LOVE THIS JACKET!!!

review.reviewBody: I have used this parka on several occasions during the start of our Yellowknife winter and always found it to be warm and comfortable despite the frigid outdoor temperature. The colour is also a bonus for increased visibility in low light around dusk or dawn. Very happy with this product and hoping it stands up to daily use over the next season.
review.name: Light, warm & comfortable at -20°C

review.reviewBody: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) Packs down really nicely into the pouch provided. Super warm! Living in the Canadian Rockies and I can wear a t-shirt under this when I just want to grab a warm layer and head outside for a quick minute. Wore this up on in mountains as well when hiking and it did an amazing job! So glad I decided to go with this jacket as it doesnt look overly technical so I can wear it in town as well.
review.name: So warm, LOVE it!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is my jacket that will keep me warm as I climb Mt. Kilimanjaro. It fits and feels amazing, it is super light weight, it fits under my rain jacket and it is WARM!
review.name: Fabulous warmth

review.reviewBody: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) I bought this for an upcoming climb of Kilimanjaro. I can't wait to test it out there, but so far it's handling the cold Canadian winters amazingly well. Love that it is longer than most jackets, so it keeps your bum and upper thighs warm too.
review.name: So warm... can't wait to really test it out

name: Super Alpine Down Parka - Women's
Outdoor Research - FW25 - PDP Videos - ODRZ8CX - Super Alpine Down Parka - Women's

review.reviewBody: My little one has wider feet and they fit him great! He loves them and they are cute as well!!

review.reviewBody: Beautiful shoe! My son is autistic and a toe walker. It might be perfect for another child who doesn't have sensory difficulties. Due to his toe walking heels get damaged and hurt. Love your brand wish for more sensory toe walking shoes in the future ❤️

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My kid loves these shoes! Fit great, a bit wider then regular kid shoes which is great! I do miss the black/rainbow color though, wish it come back.
review.name: Love the kids Newports!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I always wear boys size 5 in Newport's. 
The girls size is not the same.
I will try to e change for a 6.
Still,I would recommend this shoe if it fits correctly.
review.name: Wrong size,great looking shoe

review.reviewBody: Love how durable these kid shoes are. I can actually hand them down to the younger ones!
review.name: So durable

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my son to wear to school and after two weeks the shoelace broke where you have to adjust. I emailed because of the "Warranty" and was denied. I was also told they didn't even have a replacement, when they clearly do. If this product used normal shoelace, I would understand replacing. Very disappointed that this isn't covered.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: My family and I love Keen products. Comfortable & durable.
review.name: It's Keen— quality & durability

review.reviewBody: My kids love the Newport Sandal so when I saw these sneakers I thought they'd be perfect for Maine Spring. Purchased the same size as the Newport Sandal and sadly they are being returned, too small. The velcro is also very hard to work with as the hole is too small to put the velcro thru, so wont be purchasing again.
review.name: Runs Small

review.reviewBody: I love these Endura MTB pants! Great for cool and cold weather plus water repellent. They fit a tad large so size down.
review.name: Best fall/spring/winter MTB pant!

review.reviewBody: I've searched high and low for a solid pair of mountain bike pants that fit well in both the waist and thighs, and are long enough for full leg coverage. I haven't found a good pair until I tried on the Endura MT500 Burner pant. I'm 6'0" and weigh 170 lbs. I typically wear a size 12/31" pant. I bought these pants in size Large and they fit like a dream! The fabric is stretchy, durable, and breathable. I wear these mostly at the bike park, for DH and enduro races, but also on more pedal-y rides on chilly days. I would buy a few more pairs if I could afford to!
review.name: Finally found the perfect mtb pant!

review.reviewBody: I recently ordered a womens size small to see how they fit. The technical details looked fantastic. They were enormous. How is a 31 inch waist a womens smaller size. The extra small would be huge as well. Im 5 feet tall and have a 25/26 inch waist. I feel like they are men's sizes labeled as womens. I want a pair, but am super frustrated with the non accurate sizing. Not even in the ball park.
review.name: Womens Enduro 500 mtb pants

name: MT500 Burner Pant - Women's

hasVariant.name: Hydra Enduro S 29in Boost Wheelset

hasVariant.name: Hydra Enduro S 29in Boost Wheelset
hasVariant.description: Buy the Industry Nine Hydra Enduro S 29in Boost Wheelset online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I'll cut straight to the chase, these are the best bang-for-your-buck wheels out there. They are my pick time and time again when I am setting up a custom bike build that doesn't want to break the bank. Here's why.
For less than a grand these have the top of the line Hydra free hub from i9. The only faster engaging hub out there has a roller clutch and even those have some wind-up so it's super close form a ride feel standpoint. Are they loud, heck yeah! Unless they aren't because you swapped in some Dumond Tech free hub grease on both the pawls and ratchet ring. Then, they have this lovely delicate buzz to them. Wanna scare off the mountain lions? Swap the grease for the Dumonde Tech Freehub oil and these hubs will sing! I change mine depending on what trail I am riding, who I'm riding with, and my mood. :P
Besides the hubs though, the rims have been rock solid for 2 years of hard riding on an Ibis Ripmo. I'm 178lbs and my trails are rocky, ledgy and notorious for breaking frames let alone rims. Sure they have some scratches, but they've shrugged off all but only a few of my worst line choices. With a 30.5mm internal they are great with anything from a 2.4 to a 2.6.
The spokes are where the money is saved. That's not to say they are cheap though. i9 used Sapim double butted steel spokes to lace these up. Are they blingy like the i9 AL spokes? No. Do they come in black and you can source them anywhere for a replacement using standard nipples? Yes!
Basically, these are a set of i9 Enduro 305's with easier to find spokes plus a minor weight penalty, and they save you a good chunk of change. I love them on my bike, and it makes it really hard to recommend anything else without a carbon rim.
review.name: My "Go-To Pick" for bike builds

review.reviewBody: Can't overstate how pleased I am with this wheelset.  If you're on the fence like I was for a while, pull the trigger and spend the money.  You'll only regret not doing it sooner.
review.name: Absolutely fantastic

review.reviewBody: Fantastic wheels. Fast engagement, great quality. No Issues at all despite being a heavier rider and running these on my hardtail. 11/10 would recommend.
review.name: 1000 Mile Review

review.reviewBody: I heard so many great things about I9 wheels and hubs that I was so stoked when I could actually afford them. Little did I know these specific wheels with these spokes would be a problem. Apparently the spokes are outsourced and break at the nipple. I have had over 20 spokes break 9n me. Of course when you break them at the nippele you can't just unscrew the broke part in the nipple, so you have to remove the tire and rim tape every rime. So f these wheels.
review.name: Was so stoked till I wasn't

name: Hydra Enduro S 29in Boost Wheelset

description: Buy the Thule EasyFold XT eBike Carrier online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: EasyFold XT eBike Carrier
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule EasyFold XT eBike Carrier online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my partner, Anette. The rack is very easy to install and the ramp makes it easy to load the bike. All videos of other racks show sone strong, young guy lifting the bike onto the rack. This rack makes it easy. The triple locks are an added plus.
review.name: Excellent purchase.

review.reviewBody: Chose the Thule EasyFold because my perfectly fine Kuat rack could not carry the weight of my new e-bike. The good: hold the wrist that of two e-bikes. Has the removable ramp to help load heavier e-bikes. Does not scratch the bikes. Holds very securely. Has a built in lock. When removed from the hitch it is very compact and stores really easily. Downsides? It’s pricey. It really sticks far outside the back of the car (does not fold up against the car like most other hitch racks) so you need to be really careful backing up, parking, etc. Also wish the ramp attached more securely.
review.name: I like it!

review.reviewBody: Just used for the first time...meandering in rush hour traffic on I-95, from rural MD to the Pocono Mountains. Easy to install, connect two heavy Specialized e-bikes, and they travelled flawlessly on the back of my pick up. A good investment.
review.name: EZ is EASY

review.reviewBody: I'm happy with the purchase.  It is sturdy but a little heavy to mount.  Would be good if it also folded upwards so it is low profile.  Currently, it sticks out even when in storage mode.
review.name: Sturdy carrier

review.reviewBody: The bolt to tighten the rack to the receiver stripped. There is no fix for this small issue. The entire rack needs to be replaced. Ended up cutting off the faulty post assembly and welding on a proper 2" post (as did another person that I know). Really poor deign!
review.name: Very poor design

review.reviewBody: I purchased this bike rack to use with my new Toyota Highlander and it works great. It's easy to install and the bikes stay put. Well-suited for a quick evening ride or a long trip. I have no worries, the bikes will be safe and secure.
review.name: Reliable, easy to use

review.reviewBody: Love this bike rack.  This rack is very easy to load and unload bikes quickly.  It is also rated for two heavy E bikes and comes with a ramp to load these heavy bikes - love it.  The ability to get into the hatch with bikes on, plus the ease of removing the rack and rolling it away make this the all time best bike rack for those with a trailer hitch.
review.name: Best All Around Simple to Load and Unload Bike Rac

review.reviewBody: It was very easy to put on my hitch. Then I put the ramp on and preceded to load the first of my 2 Pedego Boomerangs. The ramp worked ok. Then I notice a problem with my pedals fitting. It took me about 10 minutes to get this bike secure. When loading my next boomerang I immediately saw a problem. There was not enough room to load because the pedals hit the other bike when using the ramp. Would not recommend for boomerang ebike.
review.name: Bikes will not fit
comment:
Thank you for sharing your feedback on Thule EasyFold XT bike racks. I am sorry to hear that this rack was not the perfect fit for your Pedego Boomerang bikes. 
This bike rack is designed to support a wide range of ebikes. Unfortunately, not every style or size of frame can be tested for compatibility due to the wide variety currently available. A Thule representative has reached out for more information on how your bikes are loaded to the rack to see if there are any opportunities to troubleshoot the fit.

review.reviewBody: Purchased to carry two Aventon e-bikes, each weighing 63 lbs. Other than needing to have a hitch installed, this rack is easy to install and remove from my vehicle. Loading and securing these heavy bikes is also simple. It comes with a ramp to help get the bikes up, but I don’t need to use that (at least not yet!).
review.name: Works great!

review.reviewBody: I bought the EastFold XT to carry two Aventon e-bikes. The installs very easy to my receiver hitch and the folding ramp to get my bikes on the rack is very helpful. Adjusting the two frame holders and getting the bikes into place is very simple.
review.name: Great Features

name: EasyFold XT eBike Carrier
